Reviews.Title: “Great Stay,Clean and Comfortable, Rooms, All rooms have great view”
Reviews.Author: DeniseTravel2010
Reviews.Content: I frequent NYC, stayed at several hotels. This hotel offers pretty spacious rooms, comfy beds. Hotel staff is very friendly! Short walk to Grand Central and PJ Clarks. Great prices under $200.oo off season.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a room with a view this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: dgp9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the UN Millennium Plaza for four nights from 11 March. All staff were very polite and helpful, particularly at check-in. I travelled in a party of three, rooming on my own. We were offered rooms on the same floor, which turned out to be next to each other. The rooms were on the 38th floor and both faced downtown. The view from my room was breathtaking with the UN building on the left alongside the East river and the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings to the right. The nearest subway is at Grand Central which is only 10 mins walk from the hotel. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 4 night stay (BEWARE OF THE DOORMAN)”
Reviews.Author: millyDurham
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay in Newyork to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. When we arrived at the hotel we were met with friendly staff, i asked if we could have a room with a view, no problem but the only one they had was on the 32nd floor which was a smoking one but was told that we could try it and if we were not happy they would make sure that we get the next available room with a view. The room turned out to be fantastic, the view was amazing of Newyork....Empire State Building,Chrysler Building, Hudson River and in the distance The Freedom Tower. The room was lovely and clean, bathroom could of done with a lick of paint but the bed was so big & comfortable there was also a flat screen tv, not that we really needed it but it's nice to have some home comforts for the short time that your in the room. Found the staff to be very helpful & friendly, only thing that really bothered me was the day we were leaving the BellBoy was very kind & helped us outside with our cases to get a Taxi (which are all lined up outside all day & night)my husband tipped him 10 dollars but then the Doorman grabbed the cases before the Taxi Driver had chance & lifted our cases into the taxi, he then had the nerve to ask for a tip, my husband explained that he had already tipped the other gentleman and that he only had enough change for the taxi, so the Doorman then offered to change a 50 dollar bill for him....what a cheek!!!!,So beware,to have your cases moved 3 feet will cost you, we could of walked straight out of the hotel ourselves & get in a taxi and saved 12 dollars,even the taxi driver commented on that particlular Doorman how forward & cheeky he is.If we want to tip we will, but won't be told to do so. We left the hotel feeling really angry....so watch out!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: zoems01
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I came here last week and loved it! Only a few blocks from Grand Central makes it a perfect hotel for getting about. Great location in East midtown. Plenty of delis, bars and restaurants nearby. Yes the hotel could do with lick of paint in places but it was very clean, staff were friendly and rooms were a good size. A good choice if you dont want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location”
Reviews.Author: moveabout2426
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted a hotel with a swimming pool for 2 young children. Room was spacious but bathroom wasn't up to standard. Very comfortable beds. Annoyed had to ask for coffee machine and then ask daily for the coffee for the machine instead of it just being replaced - more tipping!. Excellent view on 37th floor which we all loved. Swimming pool was OK but as it starts at 3'6" and goes to 8'6", it was a bit of a struggle looking after a 3 and 5 year old. However, it was really useful having the pool as an encouragement to them after lots of walking, just meant we had to hold on to them. Great location though and plenty of places to eat nearby. We loved the ferry ride from close to the hotel that took us to Wall Street/The Pier for $4.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 76sunflower
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across from the UN. It is very convenient walk to Time Square and other places. The view is spectacular! The room is a good size and has the basics. It is a little worn and needs a renovation, however how long do you really spend in the hotel room. I got a deal on Priceline and considering the prices that were on the other sites - Hotwire, Expedia, etc. This was a great deal. The staff were very friendly and helpful. There were many convenient restaurants and shops in walking distance. I was here to visit my Uncle at Sloan Cancer Center on the Upper East side - it was basically a 5 minute cab ride and very convenient for commuting back and forth from the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmac2004
Reviews.Content: Decided to take a chance on Priceline and got this hotel @ a reduced price. Were a little nervous about what type of room we would get, but upon check-in, asked receptionist about the possibility of getting a room w/a view and she was very accomodating. Clean, large room with an amazing view. Stayed on the 31st and felt like I could reach out and touch the Chrylser building! Kids enjoyed the indoor pool. Short walk from Grand Central. Staff very friendly & helpful. Great Italian Restaurant (Dean's) right around the corner and yummy pizza right from hotel bar! Times Square was about 6-8 blocks away, but lots to see on the way. Only complaint might be the outdated bathroom, but not a deal-breaker for me. Would definately stay again...had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good-but well short of perfect”
Reviews.Author: MacWilder
Reviews.Content: Speak of convenience, the hotel is located directly across the street from the main entrance to the UN. A 10 minute walk to Grand Central Terminal, though. The room was large and well appointed. The TV was big and supported HDMI inputs from computers and the like. It also had a nice menu identifying the channels. HBO is free and there are about 40 other channels, some, but not all, of which appear to be HD Nice views from the windows. There was a ironing board, iron, and hair dryer available. For no charge, one can request that an in-room coffee maker be delivered. At least when I was there, there was a very visible security presence guarding the entrance. Didn't bother me, though. Elevators were prompt and the staff was courteous. The only major disappointment was the exercise room. It is on the 27th floor overlooking the East River, so the views are fantastic. There was, however, a fairly limited number of machines and weights and the TV's on the machines worked poorly or not at all (the machines themselves seem to function OK, though.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and unpretntious!”
Reviews.Author: lakeludollie
Reviews.Content: The room shown was the room we were in with a great view of the Empire State Building & the Chrysler Building to the right and the East River on the left. The dated comments will change as the renovation plans will begin later this year. Spacious room, great bed and pillows. Ate at the bar & the crab cakes and steamed dumplings were fabulous as well as my husband's pasta!! Great views from the very large fitness center & surprised to see they have a full tennis court too! It makes our list of top places to stay in NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: tad422
Reviews.Content: Took my wife on her first trip to New York and stayed here. The staff was great, the views were fantastic. The rooms are a little dated, but were very clean. The location is great and safe, it is within walking distance to Grand Central, Times Square, and Rockafeller Plaza. We stayed in room 3412 which is a superior king with views of the city and East River.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Masonashley8
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel a bit dated but great views. And great service

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: vacationsusaworld123
Reviews.Content: Everything about his hotel was solidly good, nice rooms, good food, great service. Close to shopping and the beautiful UN neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LindaNY123
Reviews.Content: The staff were good and had smiling faces. The room is nice with a great NY city view- I requested a high floor in my email reservation and Yes we got a 33 floor room with a breathtaking view and I kept watching everything just below my feet. Very nice experience. The swimming pool however was a little bit cold for me though some people were in the water. I love the sauna. My leg pain was gone after 20 minutes staying there. The hotel housekeeping Dept. was nice too and they sent to me bath robes and slippers like I requested. We were there celebrating our son's birthday and he is happy too. We are going to come back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Kurt
Reviews.Content: Two night here.in February. The hotel is very clean and quiet. There have been recent updates to the rooms and other common areas. I will stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “good weekend deal”
Reviews.Author: james g
Reviews.Content: Front desk was friendly and helpful. View was great. 29th floor two floor suite. Stayed with my wife and teenaged son. they upgraded us at check in due to needing an extra bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for UN folks”
Reviews.Author: Sapao
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 10 nights while working at the UN. Being a stone throw away from the UN headquarters was awesome. The rooms are big and well equipped, but maintenance could have been better. The room also was smelly, probably not a non-smoking room. As I paid a very low price by prepaying online, the hotel was very nice for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “bond...... james bond”
Reviews.Author: loungelizard2011
Reviews.Content: stayed here a few times largely because they occasionally have really very good rates. when the rates are not low it is too much. nice large rooms and you can also ask for a room with a kitchennette which we do sometimes - but not guaranteed. nice clean largish rooms odd angular bathrooms tiny kiddie size loos - but powerful shower and with nice heaters which is good in winter. slightly oldish changing rooms in gym and gym is small but with good views over to roosevelt island and beyond - super hot sauna. had breakfast here a few times and it was not bad. decor very james bond - sort of seventies in the lobby - chrome and polished black stone v.dated but cool. superb views of manhattan skyline to the west or to the east sunrise and brooklyn. a little trek from grand central but loads of cheapo eating places nearby, starbucks, goodburgers, chipotle etc. very good once you get it at low rate. chamber maids are mostly jamaicans and were all really great, friendly and wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph310
Reviews.Content: Gracious at the desk, quiet room, beautiful view of the city, great east side location. I only wish that there was a coffee maker in the room. The pool and sauna are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for those who want value for money and quality.”
Reviews.Author: oneillgary1973
Reviews.Content: The hotel, soviet in size is a fantastic place if you are looking for a value for money new york experience. It offers all the comforts of a 4 star hotel; some of the decor in the room was a little dated but the size and views from the upper floors are trually breathtaking. We arrived slightly early and left our cases in the luggage room; we approached the receptionist and asked for a higher city facing room. He could not have been more accomodating for us. Just a point for those who have mobility issues: the hotel being in UN Plaza is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest subway. Overall a great hotel with near perfect views of the City.

Reviews.Title: “Big in a word”
Reviews.Author: Poppy039
Reviews.Content: I do agree witha few posts regarding the rooms being a little tardy. But I have to say, if you can see past that, it has a lot going for it. The bed was very comfortable, and the room huge. The staff were very friendly, and the location was great for me, with most business meetings being within walking distance. Nice pool and functional gym. We also got a great deal regarding room rate, which is why I have rated the hotel very good and not average. Value for money, I think you would be hard pushed to match, especially with the facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great.”
Reviews.Author: MojitoDC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently in New York. No lunch options - I checked in and one staff member says to go to the restaurant - I go, then they say they're closed... he advises me to order 24 hour room service... mind you this is for lunch... So I go back to my room... at 1:30 p.m., they then advise me that there is no room service until 5 p.m. Its close to the UN, but the rooms are dated. The shower was weak. The bed wasn't very comfortable. The TV didn't work. Kept trying to adjust the temperature and it wouldn't work. Don't bother. Plenty of other decent hotels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms! needs a bit of tlc”
Reviews.Author: lkrocks
Reviews.Content: loved the size of the rooms, the staff, and the view! needs to be attended to a bit (stains on hallway carpet, etc.

Reviews.Title: “At the high end of the Chain Four Star Hotels in New York”
Reviews.Author: streetguy
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the really good under-rated hotels in New York and if you can get a room for bargain price, you'll get a good deal. Our bright airy room was on the 34th floor overlooking the East River, the UN building and much of the city. The windows are like clerestory windows long along two of the walls and somewhat narrow down from the ceiling. During the day ihe room was as bright as outdoors and at night the Chrysler Building with its spectacular roof lights was framed through one of the windows. The rooms are big, well furnished and very clean. Bathrooms not up to the RITZ, but not paying the Ritz prices. Perfectly pleasant with nice big thirsty towels. We felt good every time we walked into the room. Didn't use the services, but the people at the check-in desk were just fine as were the doormen.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms view: one of the best in NY”
Reviews.Author: 2lady
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly as the ratio quality-price is very good. All rooms are from the 25th floor up and have a View: Empire State Building, Hudson River. A great night skyline. Some room are very spacious. Services is not so perfect, always some small problems: lamps, phone non functioning, no bathroom soaps, etc and if you want the minibar you have to rent it. I think a better supervision of the room will be welcomed. The Concierge (lady), she is great and very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a quick trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: Tanyandjord
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a last minute trip to New York. We found a decent price for this hotel and we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The lobby is beautiful! Marcus at the front desk was extremely helpful! The rooms were slightly dated, but really.. who cares.. youre in New York.. how much time are you spending in your room?. It was very clean and was rather small but did the trick. We had the most incredible view of the city. Its overwhelming to have such a fantastic view.. I was so impressed. we were on the 33rd floor. Overall It was a great hotel. I have no complaints. Would definitely book again! It is a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station. It is a great location and Im so thankful that we lucked into staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Visitors1973
Reviews.Content: The best thing of this hotel is the location. Safe, nice and with everything around. The hotel is clean, old and in my opinion in great need of a renovation. The windows don't open and internet is very expensive. We did not use the swimming pool but it seems to be very good. The breakfast was expensive so we ate always outside.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: Helena P
Reviews.Content: I booked this for a quick unexpected visit to NY. Check-in took a while because there was only one person manning the desk. We got a room with a spectacular view - all of downtown, the Empire State Building, Chrysler Bldg, the UN, the East River - we could even see the Verrazzano Bridge. Amazing, Come here for the views. The only part I didn't like is that they gave us a smoking room. I didn't even know those were still in existence. The beds were very comfortable, and we slept well. No noise from the heating system. The room needed a little extra loving care, but it was OK. The bathroom was large, and the room also was rather large for NY. Much bigger than I was expecting. We had a good laugh at the breakfast menu. Seriously, $7 for a sliced banana??

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms by NYC standards”
Reviews.Author: VijithK
Reviews.Content: The large and well appointed rooms are the highlight of this hotel. There are good Internet offers on the hotel's own website from time to time.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip, Hotel showing it's age!”
Reviews.Author: katrb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in January 2010 and decided to book it again for our trip January 2012. We checked in at 3am (flight problems) and were too exhausted (travelling for over 24hrs) to check out the room much. We woke up in the morning and we disappointed with the room. It was tatty with ripped wallpaper, dirty windows and worn carpet. I won't even mention the bathroom! We had a lovely view of the Empire State Building and part of the East River - the best thing about the hotel. We discussed whether we should complain and ask to be moved but we didn't want the hassle of moving and figured that most rooms are likely to be the same. Besides we didn't plan on spending too much time in the room. The Hotel cost was cheap in terms of New york plus the room was a reasonable size. We asked for a coffee/tea machine (free) and hired a fridge ($40 for 5 nights) which helped make it more comfortable. It's about a 10 minute walk to the nearest subway but there is a bus which goes up/down 42nd street which we used when our legs were tired. The 24hr Deli at the top of the street is really good and there are lots of nice eating places around the Hotel. If we return to New York I don't think we would book this hotel again, unless they renovate the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “First experience of NYC”
Reviews.Author: toddie1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first visit to NYC. Excellent hotel lovely room and good attention to service from staff.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels in the city that has good size rooms. The hotel is pretty good with good customer service and decent food. The location is good with everything you need in walking distance. Room service is only available for dinner and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel which has huge rooms compared to the rest of the hotels. (Considering a standard New York room.) It has really great prices, check more than once, offers come and go. You can find cheaper prices in their own website than in other travel sites. If you donÂ´t like the normal New York noise at night, then you will love the location of this hotel, very quiet! It is not right in times square, but if you donÂ´t care walking 4 to 6 blocks more than to the average downtown hotel, this is a good place to stay. I stayed on two occasions in a standard room and had a really nice view in the 31st and 35th floor. The decor is not modern, but unless your staying there all day, or are extremeley picky, who cares? Everything was super clean and functional. The beds were good. The service was okay. The bell guys were more worried about getting taxis for people who are going to the airport, but thatÂ´s not an issue. I would stay there again because of the tranquility and price. And I repeat, the rooms really are new york huge! (some people really appreciate not feeling all squished, especially if your budget is tight) Oh, and its in a safe area, so donÂ´t worry about that!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions”
Reviews.Author: TrinnyBloo
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a job assignment and we were booked into Millennium UN Plaza Hotel for a month in Sept 2011. We arrived at the hotel closed to 12.45 pm and our room was not ready. In fact, we only got our room at about 4pm, which was an exhausting wait after being on the road for 24 hours. At first, we were assigned to a room on the highest level (38th floor) that had a pretty view. However, the next morning, the whole room started vibrating and there was loud engine sound! We called to check on the situation and 2 engineers came up to inform me that it was due to a big generator right on top of the room, which would not usually happened on a normal working day (it was a Labour Day). They reassured me that the noise would go off soon. We didin't wait and called the Front desk to change rooms. The next room we checked into was on the 36th floor that was much much better in terms of view and privacy. It was a large corner room, with an unblocked, beautiful view of the river!!! We were very comfortable staying in that room til to the end of the trip. Apart from a good size and view, the room was clean, basic and tired. No mini bar or fridge or coffee pot or complimentary tea or coffee or toothbush. We insisted on having a fridge since we were staying for a month. Barry was very kind to arrange one in our room. You would probably need to call housekeeping to ask for bathrobes, drinking glasses, bedroom slippers, coffee pot and etc, which they would happily sent up upon request. The service provided by the hotel staff was friendly and helpful most of time. They would looked out for delivery parcels and would bring them up to the room especially they knew I was waiting anxiously for them. Thanks to Frank and Ansley. And also to Amy of housekeeping who had offered me some awesome tips. One important note is to avoid staying with the hotel during their peak period, sometime in 3rd to the 4th week of Sept where the UN general assembly would be running in full steam. With all the important delegates attending the meetings, the entire block was busy and security was very tight. There were also road closures, which made getting back to the hotel after a long day, extremely inconvenient! So do check the dates unless you want to be in the thick of things! Also, the hotel's breakfast was not too great. I think you will find better selections if you take a slow walk out of the hotel or to the Grand Central station basement. There were some good restaurants around the area. Just get out there and explore!

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms away from the crowds”
Reviews.Author: Teen21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located adjacent to the United Nations close to the East River; during our stay it was a very quiet location. The hotel is slightly unusual as the rooms are located on the upper floors of two towers and away from the general noise of the city. Our room had panoramic views south and overlooked the river; it was huge and not just by New York standards with two large double beds; a large bathroom and walk in wardrobe.The beds were really comfortable! There aren't many restaurants close to the hotel but we tended to eat before returning to the hotel each evening. There is also a very well stocked and useful deli just up the street if you need anything. We found the hotel to be an excellent base for exploring New York although a word of warning it is a little distance to the nearest subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: fidelma66
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel for a 10 day stay on December 22nd. the outside of the hotel was lovely ad clean and well kept, wehn we went inside it was breath taking, it was beautiful and so modern, marble and flowers and every attention to detail, was seen to. However shame this was not carried thorugh to the rooms... When we gout out of the list on the 37th floor it was evident things were going to change as the carpets and walls were drab and dull and not at all like the foyer. We etered the room and were shocked at teh size it was a lot smaller then we had thought it would be for 3 people sharing, the beds too were a bit on the small size. comfortable though if a bit soft. there is no mini bar, no coffee or tea, no fridge, and very little room to hang any clothes, my daughter had to live out of her suitcase and i barly unpacked either, there just was not enough room. There is a "walk" in wardrobe, i use the word walk loosley as you can walk in alright but no more you can step in and one step only. The Bathroom, i barely want to discuss this.... the wallpaper is stained with reminants of puke and other goo, the skirting boards have been left unkept for so long they aare byond cleaning and are filthy, the side of the bath is full of skuff marks, and even after the cleaners had been they left behind hairs that had fallen in the sink, on the floor and failed to pick up simple things like receipts off hte floor, really poor, i dont think they know how to clean. the sheets were not changed to an acceptable time frame either, it was hard to tell but im guessing they were changed twice in our 10 day stay, and that is being generous. No one eats in this hotel, not sure why, but the breakfast bar is always empty and another guest told my husband not to eat here. although one night we got room service, it was fast polite and we enjoyed hte food. Although it was over priced for what you get. On a good note... there are no kids!! my daughter is 18 and we did see some families with two children aged 11 and 15 maybe but there is none of this screaming children running around the hotel like you see in other hotels. I wish they paid as much attention to the rooms as they had to the foyer of this hotel then it would be some hotel, but the rooms need a lot of work and the cleaners need to be taught how to clean.

Reviews.Title: “Aussie Ambassador”
Reviews.Author: Adam H
Reviews.Content: Booked a few hours before arriving, allowed an early check in, great view, great service, great price, great location. Plenty of things to do in and outside of hotel. 3 days before new years and still able to get a spot here is crazy - this place should be booked out always.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view !!! ( chambre avec vue)”
Reviews.Author: Fredsou
Reviews.Content: We ( a couple with a teenager) enjoyed everything : the location ( next to Grand central station, the Chrysler building, the public library...) the view ( East river, UN building, the Empire and the Chrysler from the 38th floor!!!!)and the kindness of the staff ( some of them speak French). The beds are confortable, you may hear some people in the corridors or the clicketing of the heating but frankly we were so exhausted with the jet lag and our visits that we slept very well... We had a very Nice breakfast at the hotel on our first day ( fresh fruit, cooked or continental breakfast...) and then we went out everyday to a different place in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: sean36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in May 2011. My partner had taken me to New York for my birthday and had booked this hotel specifically for it's location and views. We weren't disappointed. The room was very spacious with a huge comfy bed. My partner had asked for a room with a view so we were put on one the top floor and the views really were excellent. The staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient. We didn't spend a great deal of time in the hotel, as there is so much to do in New York but I was really pleased with it. If I have any grumble, it would be the lack of coffee making facilties but there's a shop 2 minutes away that sells beers, bagels and a cracking cup of coffee, so it's not really a hardship.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, pleasant accomodation on the East Side”
Reviews.Author: 60795Marco
Reviews.Content: We have stayed numerous times at this hotel over the past 25 years. It began as a Hyatt property,then had several ownership changes, and now is part of the Milennium chain. The rooms are of a generous size; the health club , including the pool, is well-maintained, with beautiful views over the East River. The staff is helpful, and the clientele are from many idfferent nations. We prefer the East Side of the city, as it is quieter, not packed with tourists. The hotel is accross the street form the United Nations, which is ceratinly worth a tour.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights of pure luxury.”
Reviews.Author: redredrobyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my son, his girlfriend and my grandson of 13 months, stayed here for 4 days, 3 nights in May 2011 prior to our holiday in Orlando. On arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by Franco at reception. Check-in was excellent and he upgraded us to a suite instead of the 2 double rooms we had booked, at no extra charge. The lounge in the suite had floor to ceiling windows, giving us fantastic views across the river Hudson from one window and across New York city from the other. The staff in the bar were friendly, drinks and snacks were reasonably priced and their treatment of the baby was first class. Nothing was a problem to them. The restaurant is not open at night for dinner because as the hotel staff explained, there are so many restaurants in New York that people living in the hotel were out exploring the city and therefore it wasn't economical to open at night, We were happy to eat out and come back to the bar every night for a nightcap before retiring to bed. You can walk to Times Square in 20 minutes, but taxis are cheap and the concierge will stop taxis every minute for you at the hotel entrance. We have stayed in New York before at the Crown Plaza, Times Square but the Millenium UN Plaza was much better by far. Staff were friendlier, views were the best ever and it was lovely just to be that little bit away from the crowds.The price was much cheaper too. I would recommend this hotel to everyone thinking of visiting NYC and I can't wait to return there.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing and run down”
Reviews.Author: Dave S
Reviews.Content: postiives - nice view, and spacious room negatives - room exceedingly run down. obviously this hotel has not been updated since the early 80s. There are NO electrical outlets anywhere near the desk or bed, so obviously this hotel was last updated before anyone had a laptop or mobile phone. The only way to charge my phone was on the floor near the windows. How can you use a laptop when you can't charge it near the desk? the staff was friendly and it is nice being on a high floor, as every room is on a high floor. I was disappointed that i was given a room with 2 double beds (i am a single person and am over 6 feet tall) and was told on check in that the only queen sized bed was on a smoking floor. I am sort of surprised there are smoking floors! I usually get a 4 star hotel on priceline in midtown east, but decided to see what a 3 1/2 star was like. the prices this weekend - 2 weeks before Xmas - were crazy high so I went down a star level. And was sorely disappointed. This is a solid 2 1/2 or 3.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, very quiet...”
Reviews.Author: julesinjersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night to see a show, got a great deal on Priceline so we understood why our room was inside without a view of the East River. However, we soon realized that we could see a beautiful view of the river in the reflection of the big shiny building we DID have a view of. The room was once very elegant, now a little worn and dusty. The concierge and front desk workers made up for the room with their friendly helpfulness. They directed us to Mee noodle shop on Second Ave. which was uber cheap and uber delicious....written up in the Times repeatedly. There is a pool but we didn't hit it, and the lobby is elegant. The UN is right across the street and security is huge, we felt really, really safe.

Reviews.Title: “Time Machine”
Reviews.Author: thebumpsquad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in December and managed to wrangle a decent price on a 1 bed suite. Unfortunately you don't know in advance whether you'll be staying in the renovated rooms or the older rooms. I had no idea until I popped my keycard in the door and entered the living room which must have been decorated when Regan was still president. The suite (bedroom upstairs, living area downstairs) was MASSIVE, but some of the furniture is chipped, cracked and showing it's age. The two bathrooms were spacious with everything you'd want, although even at 5ft 8, the bath was still tiny for me - God help anyone who's 6ft tall trying to bathe. All that said, the place had a certain charm and I was more than happy with the room - cracks in the furniture and tiny baths aside. The space was gigantic for Manhattan, the bedroom area was a little more modern and the bed itself was extremely comfortable. The views were phenomenal and with floor to roof windows, and rooms starting on the 29th floor, you are guaranteed a great view. My interaction with the staff was minimal other than checking in/out, however the people I did encounter were helpful, polite and welcoming. The location is excellent for anyone wanting to be in the city without the hustle and madness of other, busier areas. Grand Central is a 10 minute walk away, and Times Square will take you 15/20 minutes to walk to - but it's New York, walking anywhere and admiring the views is part of it's appeal. So, while I'd question how anywhere with 20+ year old furniture could have 4 star status, I wouldn't hesitate to book here again if the price was right. Sure there are hundreds of hotels in New York for similar prices, but the sheer size of the suite would have me returning here.

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: SUE927
Reviews.Content: The view was great of the skyline. The bed was comfortable and there was a nice flatscreen TV. The room was spacious but did not have that homey feeling and was a bit run down. I got a great price on priceline - $175.00 but would rather have paid more for a 4 star and stayed closer to Time Square. You felt like you were too isolated.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was nice”
Reviews.Author: Ekob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. I was there for a conference - in that instance the location was convenient. The neighborhood is residential - so it's a little quieter, but there are plenty of good restaurants within walking distance. If I were coming to NYC for fun, not sure would be the ideal location. The rooms are nice - fairly roomy for big city standards. Beds are clean. TV reception was horrible, but I wasn't there to watch TV so I didn't care. If you need a hairdryer - bring your own - the wall unit one is brutal and totally old school. The exercise room is really good - one of the better ones I've seen fir hotels. Apparently there is a pool as well, but I never saw it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce R
Reviews.Content: couldnt fault this hotel,service from all staff was top ,room we had was out of this world,open curtains and we looked right on to chrysler building and empire state building,was very easy to get to .would highly recomened a stay here..will def stay here next visit

Reviews.Title: “Very good but needs improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Jarstar558
Reviews.Content: The Millenium UN Plaza has fantastic views of New York City and a great location on Manhattan's east side. It's a 5 minute walk to Grand Central Station and an easy walk to the Museum of Modern Art, Bloomingdale's, and some excellent restaurants. The UN is across the street. I've stayed here twice in the last month for a total of 5 nights. On both stays I needed a room change. During the first stay the front desk clerk couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. He moved me to a room with a fantastic panoramic view on the 36th floor. On my most recent stay the front desk clerk seemed offended and put out that I would be unhappy with a wet carpet and a foul-smelling room. She grudgingly moved me to a room on the other side of the hotel after offering two smaller rooms with less-than great views. No A+ for her customer service. The doormen and bellmen are friendly and helpful. The elevators are sometimes slow and not functional (get in, push the button, wait, get back out, try again). Some things in the room didn't work (phone, hair dryer) but were replaced quickly. The rooms are clean and comfortable with minimal amenities. Don't expect fancy little shampoos and bathrobes; it's not that fancy a place. I don't watch much TV but noticed less than clear reception when I turned it on to check the weather. The beds are very comfortable and the room lighting is excellent. The bathroom lighting could be brighter and some drawers would be helpful for those of us who like to unpack. The lobby is beautiful and modern and there are places to sit and relax there. I did not eat any food in the hotel so cannot comment on that. I was able to get what I consider a very reasonable rate for Manhattan and consider the UN Plaza Hotel to be a great find. It could use a little sprucing up and someone should go around to all the rooms and make sure things work. The management should also encourage all the front desk staff to be as friendly and helpful as they can. I know they have to deal with a lot of jerks but at least try to fake caring that your guests are happy. You want them to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ghoshanjan
Reviews.Content: Good location and really big rooms. I stayed there with a friend and after Hyatt..this was a relief and surprise. At similar price to get such grand view and spacious room was unexpected. Yes, the rooms are a bit old fashioned but functional. The buffet breakfast has agood spread.The swimming pool is very nice. I would positively reccomend someone looking for a stay-- this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Just make sure you get the more recently renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: LBBMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Millennium Plaza several times for work and it is a solid hotel. The location is good, the gym is nicely outfitted and accessible, and the rooms are good sized with beautiful views of Manhattan. My advice is to always go for the 'superior' rooms as these are in the east(?) tower and have been renovated more recently. The furnishings are updated and more modern and the views are lovely. My only complaints with the Millennium Plaza are that cell phones rarely work in your room; the internet is expensive for a business hotel ($13 for every 24 hour period) and you have to use the cable in the room; and the bathrooms (even in the newer rooms) are a bit worn (old and weak shower heads, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, dated room.”
Reviews.Author: DDBSB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Millenium UN for a couple of nights. Yes, the view was great. Check-in was good. The lobby is well-kept. But that's about it. I got a room in a high floor which had a very, very odd and confusing floor plan - not a problem in itself. The room was small (with a very thin connecting door to some other room) and in terrible need of repairs and/or renovation. One lamp next to the bed was missing the shade, the sliding door of the wardrobe was defective. And the room felt a bit dusty and dirty (even because it wasn't probably painted in a while). You could probably consider the hotel if you're doing something at the UN, but there are better 4* in town.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: LoopsToronto
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the great reviews. I don't know where the rest of you have stayed but this hotel is not a 4 star. The rooms are terribly outdated and are gross. The fridge's smell from not being operational, the carpet is so old I didn't want to take my shoes off. The drain in the shower was clogged. It was like stepping back in time. Maybe this property was good 20-30 years ago but now renovations are long overdue. Spend the extra few dollars and stay down the street. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, Great Views, Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: Oinkeater
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Millennium UN one night in November, and were lucky enough to be upgraded to a corner room which offered awesome views of the city. The room itself was large, recently updated mattress and sheets, and it even had its own kitchen with oven, dishwasher, microwave, etc. The furniture was a bit worn out, as was the kitchen, bathroom, hallways, but overall the hotel is a great value for NY, and it is in a great location (short walk to theater district and times square).

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: sparkly96
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in the city for our anniversary July 4th and wanted a nice hotel. Anything in the Times Square area was pretty expensive so we decided to try this place. The rooms were great and the view wasnt bad. We got a room facing the river in hopes of seeing the fireworks. We eneded up going right downstairs to see them anyway. This place books up early for July 4th because of the views. It's near Grand Central station and not too far from all the action in the city but far enough where its quiet. We have stayed here twice and would definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, but badly managed.”
Reviews.Author: DavidEriksson
Reviews.Content: + Large rooms with a nice view of the river. + Nice gym. + Good but expensive breakfast - Worn out furniture. - Cleaning was not so good. - Bathroom wasn't very luxurious. - If your not a diplomat the surroundings aren't very exciting. - The bed made a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tripthought_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in July 2011. The location was excellent, the price reasonable for NYC hotel rates, and the rooms were clean and attractive. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Geichenko
Reviews.Content: the main advantage of this hotel is definitely its location. Situated in the walking distance from Grand Central station, 5th Ave, and other city attractions. Staff of the hotel is quite friendly, rooms are generally clean. Wifi is available only in the lobby, which is not quite convenient. My overall stay was quite pleasant. Especially I enjoyed fantastic view from my window))) And the room was very big and comfortable. The hotel is not quite new - i would recommend some refreshment, but I found it quite OK for my stay

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and foyer...Shocking room and service”
Reviews.Author: LostDoctor
Reviews.Content: My stay for two nights were tolerable enough but considering how much the overall stay cost, it was shocking how poor value the room was. The location is incredible and the entry into the hotel is beautiful. And that's where it ends. My room, though had lovely views had a bathroom that had some bodily hairs in the bath, untidy room and little to no amenities. The hotel was a black hole for mobile phone reception and the breakfast was shockingly expensive for what you get. Suffice it to say, his hotel has been blacklisted by my company...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - and good view and location.”
Reviews.Author: Kommandousen
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located close to Grand Central Station in a nice neighborhood. We got a nice room at 33 floor with a fantastic view over Manhattan. Nice big and clean room. Not new - but well maintained. The first room we got smelled of smoking - but the bellboy immediately got us a new when he arrived with our suitcases. Around the corner is a number of breakfast restaurants and we chose Olympia a small restaurant combined with a small supermarket. Best bagels ever - and very reasonable prizes. Robert - the doorman - was excellent and gave good directions to our variety of wishes for food, sightseeing and shopping. Located close to Grand Central from where you can go everywhere by Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, awesome view, friendly staff and decent location.”
Reviews.Author: mcallongbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Millennium UN Plaza for only one night but had a great stay, The room was large and very comfortable with a AWESOME view of the UN and East River. We could also see the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially the doorman who helped with lots of details. I really appreciated the service. The location is decent (next to the UN) so you have to walk a few blocks. We were at the W on Lexington a few nights before and while it was a better location, the UN Plaza had a bigger room, better view and a bit more comfy bed (we had a king here and a queen at the W). Overall, we had a nice night and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: hockeyplayingchick
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, had worse had better. Beds were very comfy which was nice after walking all day. Would have been nice to have a mini-fridge and coffee maker in the room though. One of the two phones didn't work. The shower was horrible, kind of like a camper hand held that you had to stick your head into the corner to try and wash your hair and the tub didn't drain properly. Conceirge really messed up in booking our shuttle back to the airport - she booked it for 3p.m. instead of 3 a.m.! Good thing we caught it in time to make it on time. Location was ok, a bit far from the action but good for the hop on hop off as a stop was just at the end of the street (less than 1/2 block). Views were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “safe location, but rooms are out of date”
Reviews.Author: silverstreak32
Reviews.Content: Very large room for new york standards. We got to the hotel just before the 3 o'clock check in. No delay on room. The first room we were given was smelly and hot. 1 of the 2 phones wouldn't work. After calling the front desk, they were appologetic and said they will put us in another room. They sent someone up within 5 minutes with room keys. The next room didn't smell but also only had one phone thatdidn't work We just decided we would stick it out for 2 nights. The bathroom was a pretty good size but ready for an upgrade! The beds weren't the best but seemed to be clean. TV was Nice. The location seemed to be very safe, but a pretty good distance from the subways.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Congeniality”
Reviews.Author: 2oldetravellers
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers phenomenal views from rooms which are somewhat larger than we are used to in the Big Apple. Great neighborhood and accessible to all Mid-Town sites. The rooms were exceptionally clean but they need an upgrade - there was an almond-colored Princess phone in the bathroom. The king bed was a very comfortable pillow top but we couldn't control the room temperature which was way too hot. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view in east NYC”
Reviews.Author: Stephan_Schmidt
Reviews.Content: We have been staying with the Millenium UN Plaza for our honey moon. Clean rooms, spacy, nice service. What we enjoyed most was the view from our room over NYC.

Reviews.Title: “WOW VIEW”
Reviews.Author: strega_bambina
Reviews.Content: This was the hotel we chose for our honeymoon. Very nice, not the best we stayed (check my Loews Santa Monica review if you want to see what i like) - but clean, confortable and with views to die for! Nice hotel in center, good balance quality - money. Btw the Honeymoon was perfect and we loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hodtraveller
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff and a nice view from the windows. Unfortunately that's where it ends. Rooms look nothing like the photos and are very small. Falling behind on their maintenance. When I went to inquire about the state of the rooms considering the price I was paying per night, I was informed that they lost one star ranking. I was told that we would be moved to a nicer room especially selected by the manager. We were moved to the same room on a different floor.

Reviews.Title: “happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: deleysb
Reviews.Content: a priceline email had my intrest perked up about new york hotel deals.So i blindly bid and got a 2 night deal here. good check in-no attitude show becouse i had a priceline deal,you kind of think they will put you in the basement rooms. fantastic river view room,sunrise over manhatten,planes flying in,mr trumps tower next door. pool-just had a quick dip-its heavily cloronated, gym - tennis court ontop-unique. room great size,double the yotel i stayed at previously,and same price too. big bathroom,,toilteries-full bathtub.all fine. i felt happy to brag to my family i,m staying in the u.n hotel-thanks new york, the best city in the world-and good coffee for a $1.50 from the cart as you exit hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, good location, too busy for good service”
Reviews.Author: golisw
Reviews.Content: Really beautiful views. Had corner room with harbour view, skyline with empire state and Chrysler. Windows r wall to wall, but only short. So in bed u can't see anything. Close to grand central subway but that is a huge station and takes time to get around. Checking in took over 30 minutes. Not sure why. Very long lines. Took forever. The concierge was always busy looking down without customers. Midtown is a good location as the same green subway line takes u north to central park and museums, west to Broadway and times.square, and south to Chinatown and wall street. That's of course if there is no track work. U can still get around other ways but will take more time. View so good that there was no need to find an observation deck elsewhere. Hotel is a bit old. So bed creaked and couch was stained.

Reviews.Title: “View from hotel room outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Fcroton
Reviews.Content: Having looked at many hotels in New York, we settled on this one because it had a swimming pool and claimed to have good views of the city. Ironically we never got to see the swimming pool as there was just too much to see and do, however the view was spectacular and more than made up for the room being in need of a 'coat of paint' here and there. The bed was huge and very comfortable. We ordered a coffee maker from reception at no cost but there was a charge for the fridge at $35 for 5 days. The subway is a couple of blocks away at the wonderful Grand Central Station and at $2.50 each per ride is very reasonable compared to London.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great customer service, great structure!”
Reviews.Author: jmolsom
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel right close to the UN! You have GREAT views of the Chrysler Building (and the Empire State). Lots of eating places nearby. A nitpick: the small 34th floor window of the room I was in opened into the gusting wind! Gotta watch that if you have kids (small or not) with you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, good location”
Reviews.Author: darrenposh
Reviews.Content: Following an efficient check in we went to our room and WOW, the view to the south of Manhattan was absolutely fantastic through the panoramic windows, with the Empire State and the Chrysler building being nearby. A couple of minor problems when we arrived such as lack of bath towels were dealt with quickly. Tea and coffee facilities aren't in the room as standard but free of charge on request. The weather during our trip was very mixed and on the night of our arrival there was a fantastic to watch thunderstorm but the downside of this is that we were really limited to the hotel. We ate in the bar (the restaurant wasn't open) and the atmosphere was a bit flat though the food and service was good. The hotel is within easy walking distance of Grand Central Station and Times Square and there are plenty of choice of restaurants, bars, delis etc nearby. The only other thing of note to say about the hotel is the pool. Again, this enjoyed fantastic views of the city and was a welcome refresher after a long day pounding the streets. The lifeguard was very strict making sure that people showered before entering the pool, which is obviously a good thing. The floor lining of the pool didn't appear to be properly affixed to the base which was a bit strange. One tip is to not use the airport shuttle service advertised by the hotel. It seems to be exactly the same as what can be booked direct with the operator online but considerably more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel. Awesome Staff!”
Reviews.Author: chirpy14
Reviews.Content: It was a very comfortable hotel, clean and inexpensive. We were given a room in the tower with the pool attached, an upgrade from our original room for no other reason then the fact that the gentleman at the desk was friendly, happy gentleman. They were very helpful with restaurant recommendations and even printed a few menus for us. The room was comfortable and spacious (which is not always the case in NYC). Overall it's a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible...”
Reviews.Author: TravelToSun29
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews on this hotel before booking. I mainly wanted to stay here for the location (outside of the hustle and bustle of the crowds, but well within the city with an easy commute). I was a little worried that I would have to wait for a room, as I had an extremely early flight. I was able to check-in early, and felt very welcomed. The only person that needed a personality check at the hotel was the clerk that checked me in. After that, everything was smooth sailing. I was not expecting the views. My bellhop was wonderful, and took time to point out the landmarks and make sure I was comfortable with the room. He also was quick to recommend different restaurants that surrounded the hotel, and little bars that would allow me to enjoy the weekend football games. That changed my whole view on the staff. Yes, his job is to make sure guests are comfortable, but he went above and beyond what was expected of him. He was proud of show his knowledge of the area, and make sure I was comfortable knowing it was the first time in the city alone. I have stayed in many places, and I can honestly say, if places would realize the perfect personality Frank showed me and welcomed me with, this place would have many more people returning. The rooms could use a lot of work. The decor is very dated, and there is mold and mildew in places that could use a lot of TLC. The drapes on the window were worn and the bed was probably being held together by a rope by the way it was unsturdy, but the carpeting was clean and there wasn't any dust. The room offers plenty of space for plugging in electronics, but the wall outlets were very loose. I felt I was going to break the walls unplugging things. There is plenty of space, though. More space than most hotels will offer. I know the review of the room makes the place sound practically awful, but it really isn't horrible. If they would just invest the time and the money into a good scrubbing and some new beds and decor, it would be top of its class. I never ate at the restaurant, or ordered any room service, or even explored the hotel bar. The prices were horrible, and the room service trays left by other guests on my floor didn't make anything look good. If you turn right out of the hotel and go to the first little deli/shop that you see on the right hand side, you will get a good sandwich for a very decent price (and they are open 24 hours a day). It is New York, and you will not be lacking in places to eat. Leaving the hotel was a very quick and nice experience. I had two very nice gentlemen assisting with my bags, and were refusing to accept a tip from me (I didn't know if I should feel offended, or pleased, but they were very kind). Would I return? Maybe. There are so many places in the city to choose from. I would return just for the views alone. If they would update the rooms, I would be more than happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Sarah D
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel last minute when we got stranded in NYC during the hurricane (using hotwire). I dont know if it was just the fact we had such a bad experience at the previous hotel or if in fact it was a good as we thought! The guy on reception was lovely, warned us about the hotel being designed to sway in the wind and not to worry. The hotel room was HUGE and the view was great! as we were litterally stuck in the hotel for 48 hours due to the city been 'locked down' we decided to check out the bar in the basement. Phillip....we think you are amazing! the poor guy, as most people in the hotel had to eat in the bar he didnt stop! never failed to raise a smile and the service was still great. I would like to go back again under better circumstances!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view, nothing else”
Reviews.Author: rarmentia
Reviews.Content: It has a nice view to the south Manhattan and quite nice rooms. Sauna and pool and gym are complimentary... good! Down side: they carge you 13 USD for the internet connection No breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: dmarie250
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel a few months ago and I'm only getting to the review now. We booked this room through the "Name your Price" deal and were stuck with whatever we got. The location is convenient to Grand Central and our room offered a nice view, but that is the extent of super positive things in this review. The room was expensive (as can be expected from any hotel room in Manhattan) and for what we paid, I would have much rather spent the extra $50-$100 to choose where we stayed. The hotel is dark and dreary and the hallways were dingy and smelly. The room itself was quite unique being that it had a spiral staircase and occupied two floors. We thought this was a weird use of space but could imagine a family enjoying it if staying for more than one night. However, I spent half the night worrying that someone could be lurking around downstairs and I wouldn't have any idea. (There are doors both upstairs and downstairs). Overall, it was what it was. Would I recommend it over the hundreds of other hotels in the city? No. But as a place to rest my head for one night, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby rooms overpriced breakfast and valet”
Reviews.Author: Emlmckenna
Reviews.Content: For the price of the room I expected a more updated hotel. The rooms and hotel in general was shabby. Bathroom didn't have a decent shower. No water or coffee machines in the room. Breakfast very overpriced!! Staff were friendly and the location is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: karen h
Reviews.Content: We are two sisters with three daughters- five day shopping trip to New York to celebrate one of the girls 21st birthdays.We were greeted by an extremely rude member of staff who insisted that they couldn't give us the rooms we had ordered (and paid for 3 months earlier) as it was impossible to get a room for 3 in NY! He asked why we had demanded a kingsize bed for the 2 room (we hadn't) and suggested that we contact our travel agents to sort out the booking. This was August bank holiday Monday 3pm NY time 8pm at home! We had been travelling for 15hours- we could have wept. Fortunately another member of staff intervened and sorted things out- there wasn't a problem at all. Not a great start to our holiday and totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Middle aged hotel / Wonderful view / A little bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: petraleon
Reviews.Content: We are a couple at mid 30s that stayed for 8 days during August. We had a room at 33rd floor of the West Tower. We spent little time at the hotel and we basically chose it for the view and the good rate. PLUS - Amazing view from the room looking at Midtown. - Super-comfortable and huge bed. - Although middle-aged hotel, the staff does its best to keep it well-maintained and clean. - Nice selection of TV channels. NEUTRAL - Reception was professional and efficient but understaffed and it's usually very crowded there. - Not much to do in the surrounding area. No shopping, some restaurants and bars not worth mentioning. - The pool during August wasn't crowded but it seems really old. However, it has a wonderful view. - Concierge is always busy (only 1 person) and you have to wait to get some information. - Didn't visit the bar or the restaurant. MINUS - Location is not good for tourists. The described by other reviewers 5 minute walk to Central station is actually 20 minutes at best if you count the time to get to the platform of subway. We love to walk but since the surrounding area is kind of dull, we ended up using cabs and buses instead of going to Central Station everytime. - SOHO, NOHO, East Village, Tribeca etc. are far more interesting neighbourhoods than Midtown (especially eastern). - The hotel is in serious need of a renovation. Especially our bathroom was really dated with broken marbles and a broken shower tap that had a plastic extension. - Expensive wi-fi and computer at lobby. To sum up. If you can get a good rate and you dream of lying on the bed watching a breathtaking view, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Big is not enough”
Reviews.Author: baol1969
Reviews.Content: It is not sufficient to offer big rooms if these are not renovated and lacks minibar and other amenities. It is than awkward that in 2011 smokers rooms still exist.

Reviews.Title: “Great view but you can do better for this price”
Reviews.Author: Everab
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is for people visiting the UN, not for tourists. The rooms are as great as the pictures shows, and as everyone says, the view is spectacular. However the rooms are a little bit worn down and I would have expected better-quality amenities in a hotel of this category. Nothing is included in the roomâ€™s price, not even bottled water in your room, Internet (12 USD per day), coffee or breakfast. There is no coffee maker in the room, but you may request one for free. Gym is small but ok, you get to workout with a great view! Pool was always crowded (they have classes there). Location is good, close to the Grand Station, but there are few restaurants around the area and Central Park is far away. Concierge was very nice and helped us book excellent-located tickets for the shows, but their commission was high (we paid 150 USD for 75 tickets).

Reviews.Title: “Great views!!”
Reviews.Author: Smokeyjoelondon
Reviews.Content: We checked in at 6 in the afternoon after a transatlantic flight, but only one of our rooms were ready, so we all used one room to shower and change, then they moved us up to the 36th floor but our second room was still not ready, so not a great start, as if we pay for a room I expect it to be ready at 3 pm when check in starts.But the staff were helpful and friendly. After walking around the area ,we were happy with the location,its in a nice clean street with a 24 hour deli and a fruit stall on the corner, its a nice walk to the other more hectic parts of Manhattan, and if you wander around the local area, there a few nice delis and bars, and it feels like you are mingling with real New Yorkers,not just tourists. The reason why we chose this hotel was the view and the pool, and it really succeeded.The city view from the 36th floor was awesome, and we used the pool which is worth going to just to see the view of the East River and Queens and Brooklyn. I have to admit the rooms are a bit dated, but they are clean, the beds were superb, and there is a nice big TV. Even though the place needs a bit of an update, I think that it adds a certain amount of charm to the hotel, it has seen better days but it is still here with us,and is similar to other New York buildings that have seen better days, like Trump Tower and Macys which both need a good refurb. Next time in NYC , I will probably stay here again,as price wise, the rates are also pretty good for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: Odysseus20
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and had a room on the 40th floor which gave us a fantastic view over Manhattan, the Chrysler, Empire State buildings etc. The staff were friendly and helpful. On the downside, the electrics in the bathroom were a bit flakey and a couple of times faults needed to be reported - but were fixed. The other thing to consider is its location - right on the east of Midtown with no subway near and a decent walk from the main sights in the centre and the west. However, if you want to explore the lower east side and the east village it's a simple bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view from hotel”
Reviews.Author: GemC1985
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, staff were friendly and had probably one of the best views I've ever had from a hotel room with views of the Empire State building and Crystler building. It's around a 10min walk to the nearest subway station but a great placec to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: lewis9663
Reviews.Content: My civil partner and I stayed here as a part of honeymoon. After I had booked the hotel I looked at the website and was very impressed. The only real bad thing that I would say about the hotel is that I do not feel that the website is a true reflection of the quality of the hotel. As all websites it over eggs the standard but in this case I felt that it did so a little too much. However saying all of that this really was a fantastic hotel. We had views of Brooklyn and Queens and was on the 35th floor. The room size was good if a little tatty and clearly in need of a re-vamp. The service was good. Before our stay I emailed the nHotel to arrange for a bottle of wine to be left in the room for our arrival and this was done. The location was good, a meat 10 min walk from Central Station and about 30 mins from Times Sq. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would deffinetly consider staying here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great till I found this...”
Reviews.Author: Greenmnm007
Reviews.Content: Okay so this was a quick Priceline last minute grab for the weekend of the 07/29/11. I was super excited for this hotel due to the outstanding views, gym, indoor pool, and the option to play tennis. We (my roommate and I) arrived at the hotel super late on Friday night - the bell man outside was super friendly asked us our names and our reason for visit. He was so kind asked us about your bus ride and why we were checking in so late. He then walked us to the front desk where the man behind the desk continued his conversation with someone in the back area. He saw us waiting and it took him a few minutes to make his way forward - It was fine we were patient it was only 2:30am! He then he gave us our room # and we proceeded on our ways. The room was beautiful. We were so lucky to have a corner room with panoramic views of the river, bridges, and the city. It was so pretty when you turned off all the lights. The room itself was very spacious and I was surprised there was a large comfortable couch in it. As we were packing to check out on Sunday I noticed 3 bugs crawling on the couch - I trapped one with the pillow to take a picture of it and then it ran off in between the couch. I was actually really disgusted with it knowing that I sat on the couch and wondered how many were actually in there. I reported it to the hotel that morning of check out but how the process was done it irritated me because it felt like I was on trial - for finding bugs IN THE HOTEL. They asked me all these questions which I guess is standard but I had a bus to catch - If i planned on finding bugs I would have checked out sooner. So Overall: I would like to say that everything was a 10 - I am not a hotel snob by any means - but I'd like to have a bug free hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Good... but remember it's NYC!”
Reviews.Author: SharolynWV
Reviews.Content: Went on a 4 day, 3 night girls trip. We are in our late 30's and early 40s. We spent very little time in the hotel and were looking for a central hotel that we'd simply use as a crash pad. Pros: booked early (2 mos in advance) so were able to secure a decent rate. - beds were super comfortable - views from room were amazing - no bed bugs in our rooms Other comments: - hotel was a little out of the way .. we love to walk but by the end of the day found ourselves taking cabs. have stayed in better locations in Manhattan. - room was only 'barely' clean and bathroom was quite dated. When I saw our elderly cleaning lady I felt horrible and lowered my expectations but still a room should be clean. - restaurant was okay, lounge was pretty good but bizarrely located. lobby washrooms were in the depths of the building which I found odd and lower class. - check-in was crazy.. this hotel is busy and they should have double the front desk staff to accommodate. If you get a good rate, lower your expectations and go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: pxb123
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Millennium UN Plaza as a change from my regular NYC hotel. I stayed here because of the pool which can be welcome in NYC in August. There were both pros and cons with my stay. Pros: The room was always cleaned on a timely basis and was impeccable. The view was amazing. Bed was very comfortable. Cons: Confusion at the front desk when I checked in. They seemed to be insistent on checking me into a smoking double room when I booked a non-smoking king. Slow and busy elevators. The pool definitely does not look like the pictures but was satisfactory. Very big con: Extremely squeaky bed. All of the rooms around mine were squeaky too (from the sounds of it).

Reviews.Title: “Traveled with 2 kids and got a smoking room. Pool old and not at all as it looks on web site!”
Reviews.Author: Petersen_Family1
Reviews.Content: We can not recomment the Millenium UN Plaza. We had booked several months in advance and the hotel knew we travelled with 2 kids (age 7 and 10). And they gave us a smoking room!! We had to stay 2 (of 4) nights in the very unhealthy room untill the hotel where able to find another. You must be very patient if you need any help or have any questions. Concierge where "unavailable" all afternoons when we stayed there - and only one person in the reception dealing with everything, so big queues. Don't expect a lot from the pool. It looks much more fantastisc on their web site than it is. Much smaller and old. Only good thing is the location, the view and the very friendly (but busy) staff!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel for 20 years-Very experienced traveler”
Reviews.Author: RBryan1011
Reviews.Content: The UN Millennium Hotel is an excellent hotel for staff and services. The hotel itself is a bit of a dump since it has not been refurbished in many years and the rooms are more than outdated. This hotel located across from the United Nations in New York should be a marquee hotel but because the City of New York owns a good portion of the building and the hotel only occupies certain floors not upscale hotel chain will purchase this hotel. I have stayed at this hotel through four name changes and many management changes so this is not a one time customer making this review. Robert, the front doorman and several of the other staff members have been in place for many years and they are top notch from a services perspective. The rooms and linens are in dire need of an upgrade and this hotel needs to refurbish itself to attract more guest. Most of the clientele are from outside of the United States or flight crews for international carriers since they do not know the history of this hotel. The location of this hotel is it's major draw along with some of their long term services staff. Housekeeping and room service can be inconsistent,

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JoInAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one week unfortunately. Our room was outdated, the bathroom floor and toilet dirty, mould stains in the shower, cramped shower above bath. We had a fairly good view of the city including Empire State Building. Housekeeping was awful! One day they cleaned the room and took all the towel and did not give us any clean towels, I called housekeeping and front desk about four times over a period of about two hours trying to get some towels so I could shower and housekeeping kept saying 'yes right away' and No towels came, was told manager would call me, never did so finally resorted to walking down the halls and taking towels of a housekeeping trolley while she was in a room cleaning... THEN that night we ran out of toilet paper because they did not top that up either. Ridiculous!!! Also could not eat the hot breakfast in the restaurant and the bed was extremely creaky. TV reception awful. Happy to check out!!!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT CONSIDER THIS HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GAHELP
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I can't find a more suitable word to describe this hotel rather than "AWFUL". This hotel needs a renovation very badly. The reservation's supervisor Jason... lied to me and told me that the East tower was renovated two years ago. They have bed bugs in which I was a victim. If you are planning to stay here on your next getaway. PLEASE change your reservation. Pictures on website are not accurate nor is the hotel rating. They admitted that to me when I immediately checked out after seeing the room. Wanda Chan (GM) is just collecting a pay check she could care less about service and and openly admitted to me that the website has not been updated in YEARS!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: SAM2205
Reviews.Content: Extremely unfriendly receptionist! Staff only intetested in tip despite unfriendly and non service oriented apperance! Wifi very expensive. Try to avoid this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service and restaurant food”
Reviews.Author: 4greensinchelsea
Reviews.Content: This hotel from the internet looks a lot nicer then it really is, and rooms were fairly nice, but service and restaurant food were horrible. I think that my sister and I paid 38.00 for cold eggs, toast and cereal that had some black mystery stuff in it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View & spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: LovelyPrissana
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights on the 35th floor at this hotel and the views from our room was breathtaking and simply beautiful. Room was spacious enough since NYC hotels are known to be tiny like Europe. Bed was comfy and clean. The downside is no Subway station nearby but there's a bus stop accross the hotel. It's about 20-25 minutes walk to Time Square. Overall we had a great stay and will surely come back again! :)

Reviews.Title: “good location good staff big rooms urgently need refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: sparkyc50
Reviews.Content: helpful friendly professional front line staff incl restaurant. large rooms (we saw 3) desperately in need of refurbishment-dirty stained wallpaper looks like it dates from the last millenium and mouldy or rusty bathroom fittings not worthy of this class of hotel. no coffee maker in room- a standard equipment in many 2 star chains . excellent but expensive breakfast buffet.($30!) v poor in-room internet at $12+ per day, but wifi OK in lobby (included in room internet cost)...and free wifi in nearby cafÃ©s where cooked breakfast is about 1/3 the cost of the hotel buffet. we had a plane + hotel deal so overall value for room only was not too bad, but rooms don't deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, gym and staff. Bad Shower curtain.”
Reviews.Author: tennis105
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the old tower (pool, tennis court and gym located here) on the 37th floor. The room as basic and well designed with views over the East River and the UN building with all the flags lined up. Pros: It was great to work out looking over the East River. Fairly comprehensive gym and sauna with lockers. Pool is basic and too short for laps but larger than most Marriott pools. Front staff all excellent. Gift shop well stocked. Location ideal for restaurants and walking to Broadway shows. Original design utilizing mirrors is still good by today's standards of high end hotel design. Cons: Shower curtain liner is Polyester fabric and when wet, it would not keep water in the tub. Marble tile floor got flooded and we used all our towels up, drying the floor. Walls, Wall paper and painted doors need to be cleaned. Get the feeling they are waiting to refurbish this tower. The other tower is newly refurbished. Also the mattresses are too soft for us. Overall a good experience for the whole family. Teens were very happy and comfortable walking around the area by themselves for snacks and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it - wonderful view, nice people and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Solhoy
Reviews.Content: Our family, a teenager and two adult children â€“ had a nice stay at this hotel for 6 nights in June-July 2011. The spacious rooms at 37th and 38th floor, had a fantastic view of the city, and taking a morning swim in the pool at 27th floor gave a good start of the day. The personal, in particular the concierge, were very helpful and provided quick services. The location is practical, Grand Central Station is a few minutes away and Times Square, Broadway and other NY â€œmustsâ€� are in walking distance. This was a perfect hotel to stay in NY and would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well used average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fantlot
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel but showing signs of wear and tear in the rooms . Bathroom in particular could do with a refurb. A bit old fashioned . I had travelled from LA to Chicago on a route 66 motorcycle trip and stayed in hotels and motels coxing from $45 to $140, all of which supplied free wi fi and the majority had a free breakfast. I paid over $200 per night for this hotel with no free breakfast and charged $12 per 24 hrs for use of the hotel wi fi system. A bit mean when you consider I could walk 200 yards down the road to a nickel and dime burger joint where the wi fi is free.. !

Reviews.Title: “OK but needs a refurb quick”
Reviews.Author: johnc3720
Reviews.Content: Good points: OK location Large comfy bed Large tv Large room by New York standards Room safe Bad points; Once you get past the looby the room and hallways are very dated. Rooms really need a refurb for example the beds seems to have been fixed previously by adding a piece of plywood, see photo Electric cabling is stuck on the wall via selotape carpets worn and walls are all marked Sofas worn There is no wardrobe on a rail in the corner No free wifi anywhere in hotel I am on the 29th floor with a window that opens, ok for me but would not sleep if I had a child sharing the room Cleanliness, the shampoo had pubic hair from previous guest still attached ...... yuck see photo

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel by any stretch of the imagination!”
Reviews.Author: Jana059
