Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had booked a twin bedded room but were issued with one king size bed and told emphatically by the snooty male reception clerk that it was entirely our own fault during the booking process, although it happens all the time and he wasn't the least bit surprised as the hotel had few twin bedded rooms in any case! There was an alternative room available which turned out to be small, miserable and drab without any views which we declined due to having already paid a premium price for a room with a view and no offer of a reduction forthcoming. Whilst the lobby is smart, the rest of the hotel is horribly dated and smells vaguely of cigarettes. Our sink had three large black cracks in it which apart from being nasty to look at is terribly unhygenic. The toilet flooded the bathroom the first time it was used and we had to use a bin to catch the water flow until the maintenence men could repair it. Also, one of the drawers broke on first use and again the maintenence men were sent to repair it. However, it took more than 48 hours and three formal requests including a personal trip down to reception for my bedside lamp to get a working lightbulb which was extremely annoying. We had no apology from the hotel for any of the inconvenience. The hotel is advertised as having tea and coffee making machines but there are none in the rooms; on further investigation, you can request a tea/coffee maker but then you have to keep ringing room service for sachets of tea and coffee as they are not topped up by the cleaning staff on a daily basis, so it's all rather hard work for the customer and you are really made to feel that you are being a nuisance to the staff. Breakfast was an outright rip-off by an over-rated restaurant stating international acclaim. One glass of fruit juice, one coffee, some badly cooked and tasteless scrambled eggs and two tiny over-cooked sausages for $39. Absolutely outrageous! My daughter was keen to try out the swimming pool and this was one of the main reasons we had booked this hotel. On the two occasions we used the pool, there were no fresh towels available for us to use although there were plenty of wet, used towels in heaps on the floor. The filth and dirt caked in around the showers demonstrated years of neglect with mould and growing bacteria. Unsurprisingly, we chose to use the shower in our hotel room instead. The interior edge of the swimming pool was covered in a layer of scum. Whilst the over-bearing male attendant was happy to bark out the rules and regulations of the swimming pool, he was less inclined to keep it hygenically clean. His colleague was constantly on the phone at the reception desk 'sweet-talking' to some unseen girl; he shrugged his shoulders when we told him there were no towels and barely looked at us as we requested locker keys. In conclusion, neither myself nor my daughter plan to stay in any Millennium Hotel anytime soon and we recommend you avoid them, too! I have stayed in many lovely hotels but sadly this isn't one of them! Most disappointing! Definitely not a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with terrific view ...but wait ...with appaling service from front desk”
Reviews.Author: Greenie_cat
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positive, the terrific view from our room on the 40th floor on the old tower. From our room I could see the ESB, Chrysler buildings, on the holliday weekend the ESB building was changing into the US flag colour, it was fabulous to be able to view it from my room. However, I will not be returned to this hotel as I found staff attidute's towards the hotel guests is appalling. No smile, no standard courterous when entering / out of the lifts with guests. When I asked the front desk for the New York map and the direction to Grand Central, the front desk staff rolled his eyes and with a condeseding tone, smirking face gave us incorrect direction to the Grand Central ... instead of walk straight down on 44th street to Lexington and turning left, there were many entrance into the Grand Central station, he has never bother to explained me this, he told me to turn left and walk to 42th street, then turn again and walk down to Lexington. We follwed his direction and got lost on our 1st time out on New York streets .!!! Far out, luckily others New Yorkers were quickly to give the correct direction to Grand Central. Never once, when returned to the hotel after 11pm, we would got a smile or head nod from the front desk.... very strange. I caughed one time and nothing!! One morning as it was raining, we deceided to have breakfast in the hotel. The service was not great, staff was paying attention to business looking people whom they think may leave them some tips??? I had 2 pieces of bagels, a cup of coffee and a plate of fruits, my husband had a plate of some scrambled eggs, bacon and 2 pieces of toasts with a cup of coffee. The breakfast bill came at $62. Enough say Room is old and dated our room's the floor had red wine stained on it. The bathooom tub is very small and slippery, I managed to fall and knocked my knee against the tub !!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: Berlin04
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in hotels, primarily in the former soviet union, but have yet to experience service as bad as in the UN Plaza. I have found the receptionist "Barry" to be unprofessional at every possible level. Not only was he extremely rude and aggressive, but also, strikingly, without any respect or distance. I have the impression that this is his normal behavior as before serving me he treated a costa rican lady similarly, mocking and ridiculing her accent, putting everyone listening in an uncomfortable spot. It is beyond my comprehension how a hotel that prides itself on quality can employ Barry in a position with direct customer contact. Be assured that me and the rest of my family, frequent visitors to New York and previously returning guests to the UN plaza, will decide on a different place to stay at next time. All other staff was however excellent therefore, out of fairness, I still give two points for service.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip, we will return to the Millennium!”
Reviews.Author: Syd4289
Reviews.Content: The staff were very informative and friendly - always willing to help. The room we reserved was not available when we arrived, the hotel upgraded us to a suite, we had a wonderful time. The decor in the rooms need a little updating but we were more than comfortable with plenty of space. Wonderful view of the East River!! Grand Central station is a short walk away, all the major attractions are within a short subway ride. Lots of great nearby restaurants, we do not recommend the buffet breakfast in the hotel $25.00 per person (including children) was very expensive, there are lots of other nearby alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: KemiBello
Reviews.Content: I was attending a programme at the UN which is less than a 5 minutes walk away. Nice and courteous staff. You can get a lot of freebies here, so just ask!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: deedee8
Reviews.Content: I loved it and would stay here again. Great location - in NY but away from the craziness. Being by the UN, there seem to be extra security so felt very safe. A block from restaurants and corner delis. Wonderful staff - thank you everyone, in particular Avery at the front desk who seem to appreciate my enthusiam for being in the Big Apple (I found others elsewhere to figuratively roll their eyes at my excitment! No, it's not my first visit... but it's always exciting.) The bellmen were more than happy to take care of our bags until we returned to pick up for our evening flight home. Amazing views - one thing to see it live rather than it in movies, on the tv and in picture books. The room was spacious, clean, comfortable - really home away from home. Yes, decor is a little dated but it added to the ambience and everything worked and worked well. Example, a/c was good when we needed it (we loved that the windows opened and we preferred it so a/c wasn't required) the shower head, faucet, toilet all worked fine Quite a big gym, serviceable pool - great spinner to get the moisure out of your clothes so you don't have to walk back to your room all sweaty and drippy! There is a standard fee for connecting to the Internet but they have complimentary PC for online check-in - very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “...Luckly we did not have too many aspectations...”
Reviews.Author: pam188057
Reviews.Content: Thanks to your reviews we knew it was outdated and a little bit dirty. The only good things were the fantastic views from the rooms, the good location a little bit out of the histerical manathann crazyness and the very friendly and helpfull staff. Travelling with two children we asked for a mini bar in our room to refrigarate their milk and we were asked to pay additional 35 $. Honestely for an hotel who charge 388 $ a night you would aspect a little bit more... To report the very rude and unfriendly staff at the swimming pool who kept shouting at the children and myself included. Well, good luck if you plan to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal location an ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jadkin
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to NYC for her 50th and I wanted to make it special. The moment we pulled up outside I knew I had made the right choice. The staff made our stay a sheer pleasure. From the friendliness of the doormen to the courtesy and helpfulness of the management. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. I could not rate this hotel high enough.

Reviews.Title: “Views are amazing - a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: eagletravels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 30th Birthday in NY and it was great. Warm and welcoming greeting on arrival and the staff were helpful. Just be mindful of tips the moment you arrive. We were given a room upgrade for two birthdays we were celebrating. When we got to the first upgrade it was on a smoking floor - room was full of cigar fragrance and quite dusty. We soon asked for another room and the manager gave us the superior double and the views were UNFORGETABLE and ASTONISGHING!!! Absolutely amazing. Breakfast was right at the top of the road 'Johns'. It was nice for a few mornings but we quickly found Grand Central was a few more hundred yards away and much more breakfast and food options. Grand Central is a good point for underground transport to ground zero, Bronx, Harlem. It was cheap - $2.50 return and safe too! The best shopping advise is to get down to Bus Port Authority and order some bus tickets to Jersey Gardens Mall and Woodbury COmmon Outlet. You will need at least several trips over four days!!! Believe me - the deals are incredible. UN Plaza was a safe and enjoyable stay - bathroom, view, staff, welcome, check in and out were all fine - no problems. We did spend most of our time site seeing and shopping. Its a pleasure to stay here!! Be aware of te freezing cold swimming pool!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Room Very Tired”
Reviews.Author: TishMiles
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good news about my two night stay at this property. Upon arrival at approximately 10:00 p.m., my two children and I were greeted warmly by the doorman, handed off to a wonderfully courteous bellman and checked in very efficiently by the desk staff. (I was in NYC on business but my 6 and 11 year old accompanied me for their first ever visit to NYC from the west coast!!) Likewise, on checkout, the front desk and lobby staff were so pleasant and attentive, with lots of warmth and humor. You can't ask for a better location! As advertised, this property is less than 1/2 block from the United Nations. It is neighbor to several embassies and across the street from the UNICEF headquarters. Needless to say, a fabulous and safe midtown location. The views from my 29th floor window were breathtaking! (see pictures) What a letdown then, to see a huge black stain (appeared to be motor oil) on the floor by one bed. It was only obvious when we pulled the covers to sleep, as it was near the headboad and obscured by the comforter. Also, the wallpaper was peeling from the bathroom wall at the bottom near the tub and there were water stains on the bathroom wall under the towel rack (across from the toilet) that appeared to indicate that the bathroom had flooded in the past with several inches water accumulation. Okay -- so far, aesthetics. However, there was also a huge crack/fissure in the frosted plated glass surrounding the sink. In two places. This didn't seem to pose a safety issue, as the crack was not to be felt from the surface. Still, I called the front desk to insist that someone come to look at it, as I did not want there to be a suggestion that my young children had contributed to the damage upon checkout. The bathroom didn't look all that clean (maybe the natural coloring of the floor, which was natural stone) so we went out of the hotel around 11 p.m. to find a store to pick up some cleaning supplies (remember - to us -- it was only 8 p.m. because our bodies were on Pacific Time). 1st Avenue at 44th was very bustling, even at that hour on a weeknight, so we felt very safe. There was a chain drugstore no more than a block away - so I purchased Clorox spray cleaner and wipes. There were several Deli/fruit/flower stands open (only in NYC right?) where we had a variety of made to order sandwiches, bottled drinks and I got the kids cereal and milk to take back to the room for a light snack. After that outing, I was reminded of how awesome it was to be in NYC and was feeling better. However, upon first "use" of the toilet by my 6-year old son around midnight, the toilet clogged!! Okay - so housekeeping had a plumber in the room in minutes and the towels (that I used on the floor) were promptly replenished also. The plumber himself commented that the toilet flush pressure was a little slower than optimum. Too bad the hotel was sold out, or I am sure that I would have been given the opportunity to move rooms. Anyway -- I don't consider myself that picky -- so I figured we would just have to deal with it for only one more night. At day break, I took in the expansive views and decided...let's keep this sad little room. (The view cured a lot of ills) I had early meetings, so for breakfast, I ordered for the kids only. I called at 6:15, was told that it would be 45 minutes. They have a very generous kids menu with choices at only $8! I ordered scrambled eggs, sausage, juice and toast for them to share. One order of pancakes and one order of french toast. Surprise, the breakfast arrived only 30 minutes later, steaming hot and tasted really good (kid review)!!. The next evening, after a long outing to ground zero and statue of liberty, we got back to hotel around 10 again. The kids were tired,so we ate in the hotel lounge adjacent to the lobby. One older, very pleasant waitress running about trying her best to handle probably 25 or 30 people! There was also one bartender. I couldn't believe it, considering the hotel was sold out! Again, once the two burgers, kids pizza and side salad got to us, the food was very good. The hamburgers were incredibly tender although well-done. They must use choice ground beef. However, I couldn't believe the $67 tab! I had a light beer for $7. The kids had one soft drink each. It turns out that their 8 ounce glass of pepsi was $5.00 a piece. It NYC I guess. But, I was appalled when the waitress returned with the check and had already added her 15% tip to it!! I scratched it, gave her $11 cash but told her that although the service was poor -- I didn't want to penalize her for being without adequate help. Bottom line, if you are a Yin-Yang person, and can accept that there are trade offs -- I think this hotel will do. It is advertised as ultra luxurious -- which was far from the case. But, the location is absolutely superb and the staff are so pleasant. My experience with room service was a 10. The restaurant was a 5 or 6. The view from my room (which had to be one of the most flawed on the property -- but I guess checking in late means you get what others passed on) covered a multitude of sins. However, I did not check out thinking that I will stay here again. Next trip -- I will try the Millenium Hilton -- at least I will get my HHonors points!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Price, Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mack00013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight in NYC after catching a mattinee of Mary Poppins on Broadway, and this place was a great find. Very good price for midtown Manhatten (under $200/night) and conveniently located in the heart of everything. Just a short walk to Grand Central Station subway access. Short taxi ride to central park, shopping on 5th Avenue, SoHo, Chinatown, Times Square, theater district and even the financial district. Excellent view of the city from our 34th floor room. Room was spacious and clean. Bathroom was spacious and clean and even it came with a great view of the city. The staff was very helpful and friendly, in spite of being very busy they took time to give us directions to places and make suggestions for our evening The doorman gave us a great tip on local dining (Dean's restaurant). Great pizzas and salad and very reasonable prices. Walking distance to hotel. The other nice thing about this hotel that is a bit uncommon in Manhatten, is that they don't mandate that you use their valet parking service; rather they give you the option to self park, but the valet is probably the best option at only $46.00/24-hours. Overnight in any garage will be that much and more. Oh, and check out isn't until noon so we were able to go out all morning and then return in time to check out. There is even a pool although we didn't have a chance to use it. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “would never dream of staying anywhere else in NYC :-)”
Reviews.Author: oscabbie
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel nearly ten years ago on my first trip to New York, and will never, but never forget walking into that room late at night and having my breath taken away by the view. I could literally see the Empire State and Chrysler Building from lying in my bed, so when I returned this year with my extended family (including my 4 and 7 year old kids) we never even considered another hotel. We arrived at approximately 7pm (which for us was midnight), and the kids were beyond shattered after the 8 hour flight. We were helped from our transfer car by very attentive staff who handled a tremendous amount of luggage for us, as 5 of us were travelling round the US for 3 weeks - so you can imagine how much we had! I approached the front desk where Avery told me that as requested, they had blocked off 2 rooms for us on the same floor. However, looking at the children falling asleep, he said to me 'or i could offer you our 2-bed suite instead?". I readily agreed, and after yet more excellent service, we opened the door to our suite and could not believe our eyes! The suite was quite literally bigger than our house! We had a hallway, 2 massive bedrooms (one twin queen, one king), enough storage for a family of 20!, 2 bathrooms, and then *downstairs* there was a further hallway, bathroom, kitchen and huge living / dining area! My son stills refers to it as our 'hotel house'! This suite was in the opposite tower to where I had originally stayed (i think it's referred to as the 'west' tower) and did not have the views of the Empire State and Chrysler which was a little disappointing, but we still had stunning views of the East River and the city, and the kids were so taken with the size of the suite - that was far more important. The king room had floor to ceiling / wall to wall windows, and we never closed the curtains once while we were there - why would you?! Having the swimming pool on the 27th floor was wonderful, and there is a small shop in the foyer should you need it. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Ten minute walk to Grand Central etc and you feel very safe here even after dark. It is also very quiet in the rooms - we never heard a peep from another guest in the corridors or adjoining rooms, and there is also very little outside noise too. Upon leaving, we were once again treated to the excellent attentions of staff who worked hard to arrange a vehicle large enough to take us to the airport, and once again moved all of our luggage without us even having to lift a bag. We found this hotel to be exceptionally clean and welcoming. I am not going to lie and say that all of the furniture and fittings are new because they're not, but they don't give you that horrible 'dirty feeling' you get in some hotels, and the beds are simply to die for - I have never slept in a bed more comfortable than the ones here! My only gripe - and there is only one, is that many of the electric sockets in the suite ranged from 'loose' to 'hangin off the walls', and with 2 little kids we did have to be vigilant that they ventured nowhere near them. However, if you don't want a view of an AC unit or a brick wall in the big apple, then this is the place to stay.... backed-up with lovely, lovely staff :0)

Reviews.Title: “Wow- Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: staticlinejumper
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for business, arriving late evening to a long, multinational line to check-in and a single clerk at the desk. The clerk himself was molasses personified. The two parties ahead of me suffered miscellanous indignities: a single king instead of two beds, a misplaced reservation. Hm. I checked in, however, and keys in hand, it took (whoa I kid you not) five minutes for an elevator to reach the lobby. I began to sense a pattern. The room, on the 37th floor, had below-expectations appointments and furniture, but a lovely view- through the visible haze of chokingly bitter cigarette fumes. Fumes that I did not request for my nonsmoking room. Wooo! Calliing down to the desk got me a big metaphorical finger from Molasses Clerk: no apology, no nonsmoking rooms, no assistance, but the enticing chance to view another smoking room that might not smell smokey if I took the 7:50 Local back to the lobby. Suffice to say: you have a choice of hotels in New York. Don't choose badly and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Views; Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin3
Reviews.Content: The Millenium UN Plaza is perfectly located on the east side of mid-town. The staff were very helpful at check in and check out, and offered many suggestions. The lobby is gleaming, yet the hallways, and room rather tired. Our room, while on the small size, did have an amazing view. The bathroom lacked an extraction fan, which explains why the paint was peeling from the ceiling. For a "superior" room, it was unusual to not even have a coffee pot! While these are minor gripes, the view plus the pool on the 27th floor (which is a real treat in any Manhatten hotel), made up for everything. All in all, if it wasn't for the views the hotel would not be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: AllyM810
Reviews.Content: We had room 3125 on the 31st floor which has the most amazing views south over Manhattan, the East River, ESB and Chrysler Building. A very comfortable room. Lovely big bed. Bathroom was just a little bit shabby but a very good size. Hairdrier was a deadloss. A great central location for touring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect view for fireworks!”
Reviews.Author: sydneykatej
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel over the July 4th holiday, while we were in town for the hot dog eating contest. The hotel was clean and upscale. The beds were very comfortable, even the roll-away was nice. The room offered great views right over the East river, which gave us front row seats to the fireworks show. We celebrated at the indoor pool, which felt a bit like a sauna; but the water was nice. One thing I liked was that I didn't feel like a tourist while staying there, but rather a very important jet setter. :)

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bops03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium in march on our very first trip to NYC. We were located on the 28th floor and the views were spectacular esp in the evening. The hotel was about 10 min walk from Grand central terminal. The room was basic but the beds were soooo comfty i wanted to take one home! The staff were friendly and always said hello/evening and any questions we had were answered. The hotel itself, does need a little facelift in the rooms to make them more up to date esp being a 4 star hotel but other than that it was a pleasure to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “good welcome great view”
Reviews.Author: alismum
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter on her 1st trip to New York and the hotel could not have been better. I had emailed to ask for the room I had stayed in before and the welcoming ladies on the desk had it all ready for us. All members of staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is handy for 42nd st and (even for me) walkable to grand central and Times square. I can thoroughly recommend this hotel and would not want to stay anywhere else, the views mean you do not have to queue for the empire state or top of the rock. One small moan- I did think the cost of a fridge for the room was excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: Enasni
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in september 2010. We got a room on the 34th floor, located on the corner of 1st and 44th and thus looking out over the East River, downtown Manhattan, Empire State building and the Chrysler building. It was our first trip to NY and we were absolutely stunned by the view when we entered the room for the first time. Decent spacious room which felt a little bit outdated (the back side of the couch cushions showed the original color...), but the view and comfy bed made up for it. Downside for the casual tourist might be the location: a ten minute walk to Grand Central as that is the nearest subway station although we didn't find it that disturbing. Nice staff, although we only needed them for checking in and out...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fab location and a great gym..”
Reviews.Author: EastOfEngland061
Reviews.Content: This really was a Christmas shopping trip that was made fantastic by the helpful and friendly staff at the UN Plaza. Their attention to detail and willingness to offer advise was second to none. From suggesting which show to head to or what time was best to get to the attractions all helped with the planning to get everything crammed into a long weekend. There was some confusion over my booking when I arrived but this was dealt with swiftly and the staff corrected this in no time. I would suggest the New York breakfast in the restaurant and the gym facilities are really good. The mini bar helped the desire to use the gym!! I would recommend this place to others and suggest a room on the higher floors for the views.

Reviews.Title: “Grate value, fantastic wiev,splended service.”
Reviews.Author: ollisen
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotell in a grate location, friendly staff, spacy room, clean. Will be needing renovation in a few years, but everything works ok and we had a fantastic stay. A very quit area and high security hotel, nearby UN. Walking distance to Central Park,and down to Empire State, grate location. 10 dollar, cab to Ground Zero, Wall sreeet.. Stayd in 37 floor, fanatstic wiev towards East river and Queens, cant be described by words.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: thatsmystuff
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the UN Plaza repeatedly over the years, and have generally really enjoyed our stay. It's comfortable, the staff are friendly and helpful, and the views spectacular, whether you're looking down the river or facing Midtown. This time, we were given a room on the west side, and again overall, were not disappointed. However, the decor is getting dated and tatty, and for anything longer than a few nights, would feel below standard. On the positive side, we had a small kitchenette and opted to buy breakfast items in the local delis, along with coffee from the van helpfully parked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star? Really?”
Reviews.Author: sugarrain73
Reviews.Content: We were so excited about coming to New York and staying at this hotel but we were so disappointed. When arriving at reception we were slightly amused by the mirrored dÃ©cor but check-in was speedy and we made our way up to our room in the painfully slow lift. The corridor we arrived in stank of stale cigarette smoke and was dull and grimy. This theme continued in our room. The man on the front desk had not mentioned we had been given a smoking room; he did not ask for our preference and we did not think to request a non-smoking room. However this was not the only disappointing factor about the room. The furniture was old and worn, as was the bed linen. The curtains were covered in stains and the chairs in the room were disgusting; smelly and soiled with who-knows-what. The â€˜kitchenâ€™ area was horrible and dated, the air conditioning was antique and the bathroom was grim and needed a good dose of bleach. We requested to be moved, at least to a non-smoking room, but were told that none were available until 3pm the following day. Rather than have to unpack, pack again and carry our valuables (passports etc) around with us the next day, we decided to put up with it for the four days we were there. In the end we were laughing at the many things which went wrong; we received three random phone calls in the middle of various nights with no-one at the other end, the T.V signal constantly dipped in and out and we returned one evening to discover a ceiling tile and a light fitting had fallen out, exposing wires and electrical equipment in the ceiling. In fact we almost walked into the tile as it was hanging in front of the doorâ€™s entrance! There is no free wi-fi in the rooms, which is annoying, and we werenâ€™t keen on the location of the hotel. We never felt unsafe walking back at night but it was rather lonely and there arenâ€™t many bars within easy walking distance; we ended up taking cabs to livelier parts of the city. Plus points? The doorman Roberts was friendly and gave great tips on restaurants. Yes, the view is spectacular but I would have substituted this for a clean room. Thankfully our window opened so we could try and relieve some of the smell. New York is an amazing city but we would never stay here again. How this is a four star hotel I do not know; maybe in the 1980s but not now and certainly not the room we were given.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating in common areas etc- but not bad”
Reviews.Author: lovesylvie
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a place I would rush back to. The carpets in the hallways are old and filthy. Clearly they have not paid a lot of attention to upkeep in certain areas of the hotel. However, the room itself was clean-

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: AffairsinMiami
Reviews.Content: Saying here now. A bit disappointed that the rooms have not been renovated and the hotel looks and feels run down. The bathroom is old fashioned and the fixtures have rust on them. I asked to move to another room but was told they all look the same!. The staff at the front desk is great and very friendly and helpful especially Peter and Barry. The concierge can be a bit friendlier and more knowledgeable But provides the service. Will not be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb accommodation - stunning views of NYC”
Reviews.Author: UK_Steve007
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to New York and we were not disappointed with our choice of accommodation having researched considerably on Trip Advisor, so I hope that these few words help somebody else with their choice. The Millennium UN Plaza is quite simply excellent; from the moment we arrived to the moment we left our stay was wonderful. We arrived a little early from JFK however the front desk were extremely friendly, informative and most accommodating and allowed us to check in at that time, so we didnâ€™t need to wait around. Rooms within other hotels in NYC are usually on the small side so I am told however our room here was most spacious, king size bed (at least), flat screen TV and room safe etc & extremely clean. Reasonably sized bathroom, with bath/shower, sink, toilet & hairdryer etc â€“ what more would anyone want. Our room was simply superb, views were stunning night and day, and we could not fault it at all. We had a view over the east river looking south towards lower Manhattan/Wall St etc and it was stunning any time of day, also great views of both the Empire State Building and the beautiful Chrysler building, stunning. It was a pleasure to wake up in the morning, and always a pleasure to return. 27th Floor â€“ the pool and the fitness centre are wonderful. And there is also a sauna although we did not use it. FYI you need to use the 2 right hand side lifts in order to access the 27th floor. Well worth the effort and a great way to relax after a hectic day around the sights. The Millennium Plaza is a wonderful hotel, we did not want to leave and we will certainly return next time we visit NYC, thank you to all the staff for making it a great stay. If you have not visited before this may help too: To and from JFK â€“ we used an official yellow cab. There is a flat rate fare of $45 + $5.30 tolls + tip (15-20% expected â€“ we paid $60 and the drivers seemed very happy with that). At the taxi rank tell the attendant you want the flat rate fare to your destination before you depart (if that is what you want) else you will get the standard metered fare. You will then be given an official piece of paper with the driverâ€™s number on etc, which I thought was most re-assuring. The journey took about 25 minutes but I think we were very lucky, expect anywhere up to an hour in traffic, which is what it took when we returned to JFK. Again on the return leg donâ€™t forget to ask for the flat rate fare. We also got charged the $5.30 toll upon the return to JFK, not sure why as I think it is a one way toll but I could be wrong, still it wasnâ€™t worth the debate during or at the end of the journey. There are some cheaper alternatives into Manhattan but for the few extra $s I have to say door to door this is far the easiest and best use of your precious time. There is so much to see but here are a few we did and would recommend: Rockerfeller Centre for great panoramic views, you can get a 2 visit ticket to see night and day. Well worth it. Staten Island Ferry â€“ its free, and stunning views of Skyline, and of Statue of Liberty. Central Park â€“ with a good pair of walking shoes. Grand Central Station â€“ what a wonderful building & only a 5/10 mins walk, couple of blocks straight down 44th. The underground - is a must just to say you have done it, very safe in the day We used it a couple of times to return from Lower Manhattan which is worth a walk through the different areas but takes time ($2.50 per single ride, pay at machine). We found Grand Central station to be the closest to the Millennium Plaza hotel, plus there was something special about disembarking at the iconic station that appears in so many movies. Also there is a great Deli at the corner of 44th and 2nd, turn right out of hotel lobby and 2 minutes if that, on the corner. It has every thing you want and very reasonable, coffee, donuts, fresh sandwiches, you name it has it. Great place. Trip Advisor has been a great resource to me so I hope these few words are of use to someone else especially if you are new to NYC as I was, and the few places mentioned are just a sample of the many places to see and visit. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Still just as great the second time!”
Reviews.Author: Jabesta123
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at Millenium UN Plaza hotel. The hotel is great and the staff is very friendly and accommodating. It is not too far from the city. If you like walking not a problem at all. My girlfriend only wears heels so we didn't walk to the heart of the city. Beautiful view. Security in fron of the building made me feel safe. Concierge held our luggage after we checked so we could go out on the town until our plane left. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luciano65
Reviews.Content: first the view from my room was gourgeous......and the recepcionist on arrival was very very kind....you know sometimes in nyc being a big city people not always are nice.they are very helpful introducing you places to eat and go even if wasn't my first time.the only thing was that they need to add coffee maker in the room PLEASE!!!!! jetlag sucks so you need coffee at 4am and you have to go out!!!but I love it ...and going again nov 11th.

Reviews.Title: “Fair level business hotel in a good position with a shiny lobby”
Reviews.Author: Priv_Dis_Lux
Reviews.Content: The views of the city are really agreable specially from high floor rooms.. Bathrooms decent with average toiletries. Dressing room with the safe but with the lack of the minibar..Spatious rooms with comfy beds. The room could be refurbished to improve the allure but this a good priced business hotel ..so for the price is difficult to ask more in a safe Manhattan area.. Service, Staff seems always missing but the idea is that of a Residence Hotel..so more on the serviced apartments view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For Us”
Reviews.Author: Darren8579
Reviews.Content: When reading Trip Advisor reviews it is clear that people want different things from their hotel experience. For us, it's the hotel location coupled with clean rooms and if the staff are friendly that's a bonus. Our experience at the Millennium Plaza was just perfect. The room was clean and the bed and bedding were spotless. Our room was cleaned to a high standard each day which made returning from a hard days sightseeing a pleasure. All members of staff greeted us with a smile and were very helpful, especially when we returned late one night after a visit to the theatre and had left the room key inside the room. The pool is a must, with great views of NY. Just across the street is the UN building, the 1 hour tour is a must. Outside the front of the hotel is a street vendor who sells coffee at $1.50 to kick start your day. Grand Central Station is much more than just a station, take time to explore this amazing building. Each day we felt safe walking back to the hotel. After visiting the theatre we managed to get a taxi back from Broadway for $10.00 including tip. - Got the Subway back on other late nights as the taxis were all busy, but felt safe enough on the Subway, plenty of Police around. If we go back to New York, we will stay here again without a doubt, just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Behmon
Reviews.Content: First impressions, the hotel is nice. The doorman (Robert) was wonderful, as were the front desk staff. Making my way to my room on the 37th floor, I noticed that the lobby area is up to date and immaculate. Howver, the corridor on the 37th floor has stained carpet. The room is nice and has a great view of the ciry and the East River. The sofa in the room has a few stains (I don't even want to know what from) but otherwise the room looks great. The bathroom is dated but functions well. Some of the bathroom lights are dim or not working, but otherwise acceptable. The hotel is quiet during the night. Early in the evening one can hear the neighbors talking in the hallway, but no traffic or weather noises are heard. The onstie restaurant is the Ambassador Drill Restaurant. Though the booklet in the room tells me that the restaurant is open for dinner 7 days a week from 5:00 PM to 10:30 PM, this is not true. The restaurant is not open after noon, so one is supposed to eat in the lounge. I went to the lounge twice and was quite surprised that I was not seated or acknowleged - and there were only three other patrons in the place! Needless to say, I had to walk to nearby restaurants to eat my evening meals. Breakfast at the Ambassador Grill is good but EXPENSIVE. Plan on laying out $30 per person for the buffet - way too much for what one gets if you ask me. I did not use the gym equipment but did attempt to use the pool (located on the 27th floor). The gym and pool are open to hotel guests as well as outside "club" members. A bitter old woman (a club member) gave me such a hard time about using "their" pool that I just packed up and came back to my room. It is a shame that bitter, snotty people ruin what should be a relaxing experience for guests of these hotels ... especially considering the amount of money we pay to stay here. Needless to say, I'll not use the facilities the rest of my stay. I titled this posting "Mixed Feelings" because there is potential for this hotel to be a fantastic experience for NYC visitors. However, because of the lack of attention to keeping the facilities and dining available to guests - without hassles - I'll seek somewhere else to invest my hard earned $$ next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel on a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: travelling_gunner
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and safe hotel with friendly staff. All these elements in one place isnt to easy to get on manhattan. People are a bit and cocky, tossy and full of the old city they live in. The hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan walking distance from Time Square. Just a typical American4 star hotel (dont know actually how many starts they have and who gave it to them). Breakfast around the corner (john restaurant/cafe) is way better then in the hotel and much cheaper. Definitely a good place to stay for NYC standards!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in East Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: canotaro
Reviews.Content: So very happy we stayed here. Near Grand Central Station. Loved everything about this hotel. Looking forward to staying here. The views of the Empire State/Chrysler are great! Friendly and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMiamiGirl
Reviews.Content: I am actually still staying at this hotel now, and wanted to urgently let people know that this hotel is great. My reception was warm & pleasant. The concierge is my new best friend. And I really cannot complain about the room at all. I read several iffy or negative reviews, but I am glad I took the chance. Great room, AMAZING VIEWS.

Reviews.Title: “You could find better”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-NZgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. The location is ideally situated for the UN, and about 5 mins walk from Grand Central. Its not a busy area though at night, so I felt slightly unsafe walking back from Times Square one night at about 9pm. The rooms are big. There's plenty of space. And the view is nice - I was on 34th floor, looking over the river. And the pool was lovely - theres a pool, sauna (on the small side and not overly hot, but fine) and some exercise machines. The view from the pool is also fantastic. But, there were lots of things that weren't what you'd expect for this price. And I was there for 7 nights, so it got a bit annoying. Firstly, the service was poor. I arrived and there wasnt an iron in my room or a sewing kit (I needed a needle). I rang and asked for them - was passed through different departments of the hotel and had to argue with them re the need for an iron, apparently there was one in my room (there was meant to be but there wasnt). Had to wait 20 mins for someone to bring me an iron, and when the iron arrived was told that I had to wait for someone else to bring me sewing kit (and by sewing kit, I just mean the needle and thread you get in pretty much every other hotel). So that was about an hour of waiting in room for basics. I also disliked the fact that the hotel only provided cheap soap - there was no shower gel, and the soap was poor quality - it was one of those thin white bars. You can request a coffee machine in the room, which I did. Machine arrived, with 2 packs of coffee. I was there for 7 days. When I ran out of coffee I rang and requested more, again I was told that it would take at least 30 mins to come to me - about 40 mins later they arrived, with one pack of coffee and one of decaf. I would have thought they could have serviced that with the rooms or given enough coffee for the stay. It felt cheap, and unnecessary given I was paying around $200 a night. Other service issues I had - on check out, there was a 30 min plus wait as only one person at the desk for midday check out. This was also annoying. On the plus side, when I left the doorman helpfully insisted on finding me a taxi and ended up taking me down to 1st avenue to hail one. He was very nice, and refused my tip. Back to the room - it was noisy. I dont know why. The air conditioning was far too loud to have on at night (and it was winter anyway) but there were weird noises in the room which kept me awake. I was in a corner room, close to the lifts - but I still dont know what they were. The first night I walked outside my room trying to identify source of noise but couldnt. Basically sounded like some kind of constant generator type sound. Very annoying. I probably should have complained but given I was working long days, and the unresponsive service on other issues (see above) I didnt think it was worth the hassle. Other people staying there also commented that the rooms were noisy. I'm 99% sure they didnt change the linen the whole time I was there. There is a note by the bed that if you want your sheets changed put this note on the bed and we will change, otherwise we will change them every three days. I dont think this happened. Towels were replaced though. The internet is expensive - $13 for 24 hours of wifi. If you log on using two separate devices (ie, iphone and a laptop) they charge you twice. I did ring about this halfway through stay, and actually got a helpful person who said that this happened, deleted the double up charges and told me just to choose the iphone or laptop for rest of stay. So, I guess it was good that some of the charges were deleted, but it was annoying only being able to choose one or the other. Again, i thought it was a bit petty and cheap. And there's a bar and restaurant. I didnt eat breakfast there (very expensive) and did have drinks at the bar - the waitress was so grumpy it was almost amusing. The rooms are not particularly modern, you can tell in the furnishings where they used to have fridges and safes in the room - but they don't anymore. I was surprised there wasnt a safe. So, if you're working long hours at the UN, this is conveniently located. But, even if I was going back with business, I'd try very hard to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “No security at night plus an early wake up call from maids”
Reviews.Author: hyperchic186
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great but the service is quite lacking. I stayed here for three nights in March and can only say that this hotel needs a lot of improvement. I spent about $200 a night and got an amazing room on the 37th floor. The room was big and had enough room for my friend and I to unpack our things (believe me, most hotels in New York I end up living out of my suitcase because of the lack of room). It had an amazing view of the Empire State building and all I could think was what a great hotel. It got worse from here... 1) I got home after 4 a.m. on two nights to find no one at the service desk and no security guard in sight. The problem with this is that a man tried to follow me into the hotel and I ended up running for my life because there was no one there to protect me or to report my situation to. This hotel has bomb sniffing dogs during the day but no security at night? How do UN officials sleep at night? Anyone could walk in. 2) I got an early wake up call from the maids every day. The worse was on check out day when the maid came knocking on our door at 8:30 a.m. It was like they were asking us to leave and as quick as possible. I was more than pissed off. Most hotels don't starts cleaning rooms til about 10 a.m. I would not stay at this hotel again. The view was worth it but the service, not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out room, but decent price”
Reviews.Author: Diego032
Reviews.Content: For a good internet rate our stay was fine, but the room was very worn out, the door of a closet was broken, no minibar, no glasses, nothing extra, no amenities, a broken curtain, worn out bathroom and a view to a wall of another tower. This is a mediocre 3-star hotel, but with a good price it's bearable. The staff however was nice and the room was clean. We didn't feel like hanging out in the room since it was a bit depressing, but it was fine since many people don't come to New York to stay in the hotel room. The breakfast is just ok, but nothing special. The location is very convenient if you need to go to the UN.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC value”
Reviews.Author: siva2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Millenium UN Plaza because I found a great internet rate. We were extremely pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a very large suite with great views. The rooms were clean and had so much space we wished we were staying for a week. I think that if we had needed a suite for entertaining we would have been disappointed as the kitchen was completely empty of plates, silverware etc. However, this is not a fancy hotel, but a good value hotel. And that it is. All the staff we met were extremely pleasant. It is about a 10 minute walk from the subway and further to various destinations. We enjoy walking, so that was fine, but if you don't like to walk, it is a bit removed. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking view”
Reviews.Author: govanboy47
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to new york, i had emailed asking for a view of city , and boy did we get it , opened curteanis to see empire state and chrysler building in all there glory.the room was very comfortable and staff also very helpful. the location we though was perfect close enough for short walk to grand central , and quiet enough at night, we would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone going to new york , also like other we used the little deli on the corner for breakfast , fantastic bagels abd subs, and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot4774
Reviews.Content: For the right price this hotel is a decent value offering albeit a bit off the beaten path. Short walk to Grand Central (5-10min) where you can take a 2 min shuttle to T.Square. UN location means lots of security/police 24/7 so no problem walking around at night. Heated pool and very modern health club amenities with amazing skyline views are great for the athletically minded. Hotel staff were cheerful and accomodating. Downsides were the dated looking rooms and decor. Bed squeaked, couch looked straight outta 1995, no fridge, had to request a coffee maker, but the positives were it was clean, everything worked, and the TV was at least new and modern. the $12.95 per 24 hrs internet charge is ridiculous as was the $1.50 per call initial dial out fee. Didn't try onsite dining so no comments there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff in New York and good value for money but the rooms need some maintenance...”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadgeneva
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at this hotel for a long stay while working with the United Nations. The staff is the friendliest and nicest I have encountered in my many travels around the world. Most of them remembered me from my previous time there two years ago and always went out of their way to help me or answer questions. The rooms are really large, especially for New York standards, with thick walls so it's quiet and the views are fantastic! The rooms are also clean and the beds super comfortable. There is a pretty good fitness center and a huge indoor swimming pool. You can get great rates on their website, too, so it is real value for money. I was disappointed, however, to note that although the lobby area is in quite good shape, the maintenance of the hallways and rooms has deteriorated. The wear and tear is obvious and repairs and refurbishing are needed to clean up stains in particular. Internet access was also a problem and no matter that the hotel connected us by phone to their provider, in the entire two and a half weeks we were unable to have internet access in our room (it is also an additional charge and I still don't understand how less expensive hotels can provide it for free!). The location is great for UN meetings but the truth is that almost anything that you need is within walking distance (laundry service next door, deli and other restaurants a block away, shopping areas a few blocks away). I recommend this hotel to my colleagues and friends who are looking for a comfortable, clean, good value for money and, most importantly, a friendly place to stay in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Fantastic Views”
Reviews.Author: orangeCheshire
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this hotel and I will honestly recommend it for Value and Location, it is a couple of block away from the tourist area and is not so busy. There is plenty of restaurants in the area within walking distance John's Dinner and the Deli on the corner which are reasonably priced. I would also like to than the Reception Staff for the kindness they extened our checkout time by 4 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: psandps
Reviews.Content: The public rooms are dated - lots of chrome and glass - but the rooms are more modern, are very comfortable and quiet and have great views of the city. The location is few blocks from Times Square but as the name implies, it is very handy for the UN institutions. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the breakfasts are overpriced - there are plenty of diners in the area that have much more atmosphere and are better value.

Reviews.Title: “Not so sweet”
Reviews.Author: travellerfromatown
Reviews.Content: One good thing--the room was large. And that's about it. Carpeting had stains, no refrigerator, minibar or safe. Bathroom tile was gross. I'm glad i brought my own pillow. But the worse thing was the shady service. We got there right after the big snowstorm. My husband parked the car in front, as close as he could, considering the snow was not plowed. After we unloaded, the "valet" actually told him to move the car closer to the curb. btw, parking is $40. After waiting at least 15 minutes for the front desk to cimplete one transaction, it was finally my turn. When I went to initial the reservation, the rate was incorrect. It was the standard rate, rather than the orbitz rate. The surly clerk said that I should just initial it because he'd change it in the computer. Then I noticed that the reservation was for 2 nights, not one. I pointed this out (note there is a penalty if you stay less time). Then,, he took the unsigned paper back and said he'd corrected both items in the computer. I had to ask twice for him to print out the corrected reservation. I am not usually a paranoid person, but I definitely believe he was trying to pull a fast one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Newtonian2
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting a lot more than a reasonably-priced (by New York standards, anyway) room. But when I pulled back the curtain and saw the spectacular view of the Chrysler Building and the Empire State, my jaw dropped. The location is slightly out of the way (unless you want to be at the UN), but that's why the view is so great. It's a real treat and worth the extra walking (even in the late December slush). The chief drawback: pricey wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JJH1
Reviews.Content: This was a combination business and Leisure trip for two married couples. Instead of two seperate rooms we opted to share the two bedroom suite. Not only did that save us money the room was superb, top floor of the West tower with windows on both sides of the large living room. The bedrooms were large and comfortable. It was freezing cold in NY and the heat in the room was more than adequate which given all of the windows in the room is important. The views are the best I have had at a NY hotel. Wake up in the morning and look out across the city to the Empire State Building or down the east river. Could see all the way to the Varazanno Bridge. Although this hotel is not in the main tourist area is is about a 15 minute walk to times square or Rockafeller Center. Since this area has more residential housing their are lots of small restaurants and bars that are more lay back and less touristy, but with excellent food and a chance to experience the real NY. The fitness center was well equipped and also had great views. The suite came with a small kitchen with a stove but no microwave, also no pots, pans or even kettle to heat water. So unless you buy or bring your own kettle or pots and pans the kitchen was pretty much a waste. They did supply coffee, tea and a small coffee pot for free upon request. It seems a small thing to supply a kettle and a few pots and pans, I often stay in similar hotels in London and they stock all of that including glassware and china, seems petty for this hotel not to do the same. Wi-Fi was provided but not for free. Otherwise a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: greatdad04062
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family from 12/10-12/13. Great location. Easy to get around the city. Staff were terrific. Well worth the price, and with terrific views. We were upgraded when we arrived once the staff met my son (8 yo). Barry was fabulous with him, and gave us a corner room with views all around. I suppose the hotel could use a little TLC, but certainly it is much better then others in the area/NYC. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep like a baby in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: Havenisse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Millenium for five days. We had a great room with a view of the river and the long avenues. We spent hours just looking out the windows - it was like sightseeing right from our room. The room was big, quiet and very comfortable. The beds were wonderful. Normally, I have trouble falling a sleep at hotels, but here I slept like a baby! The location was probably a bit better suited for business than pleasure. During the weekend many restaurants were closed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel During Christmas Season Visit”
Reviews.Author: go_steelers001
Reviews.Content: We went to NYC to see it decorated for the Christmas Season. We wanted to stay closer to Times Square, but since our visit date was last-minute, this was the only hotel in our price range that had available rooms. We were offered a free upgrade to a suite (by a very attentive front desk), so we jumped on it. The view was very good, so the kids were happy. The room was very spacious (I'm talking almost jogging-track spacious) and clean with top-shelf toiletries in the bathrooms (soap, shampoo, etc.) so my wife and I were happy. The only quibble I had (I know, who would quibble with a free suite upgrade, right??) was that the sleep sofa was not comfortable at all for our teen son. The mattress was very thin and pretty mis-shapen. We also found some stuff from previous guests hiding inside with the mattress. We asked to have a roll-away sent up for our teen daughter to use. She had no problem with it. My wife and I had a very comfy king-size bed. All-in-all, we were very happy with our stay at the Millennium UN Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"It's OK" Just About Covers It...”
Reviews.Author: Fifitrix_Scotland
Reviews.Content: On check in at 2.45pm we were advised the rooms weren't ready and would be a half hour. Told to go and get something to eat/drink but we were to wait for someone to collect the bags from us. So we waited, and waited... After 20mins, I asked what was happening. Just wait for the bell boy was the reply. Ok, so we waited another 20 mins. Finally, after I asked about the room again we were given a key to one of the rooms and told our bags would be delivered. After an hours wait we had to get them ourselves, even though there were at least three bell boys in the lobby. Is this really the way to treat new guests? The rooms were big with amazing views. Our rooms were 3438 and 3439 with a connecting door. Between the connecting doors were scraps of biscuits and the carpets were badly marked in areas. The standard of the bathrooms was poor. They really need updated, especially the showers. After a long day a tea or coffee would have been most welcome but there was no hospitality tray in the room. Perhaps this is the American way? The beds were fantastic, really comfy, which was great as after a hard days shopping and sightseeing it was sorely needed. The public areas are very nice and the staff were pleasant enough. Everything was expensive though, for what you were getting. We didn't even consider the breakfast as it was a total rip off. I would say I wouldn't recommend this hotel, purely because for the same or a little more money you could have a far superior experience.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_europe_20
Reviews.Content: we've stayed in this hotel for a few days and liked it. it was nicely furnished and clean. the view was amazing as we've had a room on the 31st floor with city view. it's around 10 mins walk from grand central station which was a bit far for this short stay. therefore we've taken most of the time a cab back to the hotel. otherwise is the location very good and quiet. i'd recommend this hotel to my friends. however if you're short on time then i'd recommend a hotel closer to a metro station e.g. times square area. the prices would be similar. the travel period was ideal as we've been able to get the black friday bargains which were in some shops e.g. bloomingdales or macy'd up to 40% off.

Reviews.Title: “The View The View The View!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KimPatton
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is clearly from 1976, the view from the 40th floor was spectacular day & night just something I will remember for the rest of my life!!! I personally love NYC - I'd stay here a thousand times more if I could have the same room - the view is just to die for. Now for the shower - please do something about this - refurbishment comes to mind, starting with a new shower head -

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chellgrenc
Reviews.Content: Not awful but absolutely not 4 star quality or service. The room was standard (bathrooms could use some updating) and the location was good. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning. It took over an hour, one breakfast was completely forgotten causing an additional 40 minute wait. The woman taking our order barely spoke english which resulted in NOT ONE of our 3 omlettes prepared as they were ordered. They were also clearly made with powdered eggs and tasted horrible. For $170 breakfast, we at least expected it to be edible.

Reviews.Title: “To avoid, seriously”
Reviews.Author: yanspace
Reviews.Content: I won't recommend this hotel for any kind of stay. First, we were 2 couples with separate rooms. We booked non-smoking rooms and of course, we getted SMOKING rooms. So we immediately changed and we get a suite with 2 distinctive rooms which in first instance could appear as an upgrade. Yes, for the view which was awesome but everything in the room had at least 30 years. They still do have a videotape recorder .... some spigots had leaks ... One reason for which we booked this hotel was the gym and swimming pool. We were really excitted to swim a bit after a long walking day - but the swimming pool was frozen (water and air) - I get a cold only after having spent 20 min there (not a lie). We did not take the breakfast as it was horribly expensive and the submay is not so close. So no, do not stay in this hotel if you want a good quality/price ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels screams renovate me”
Reviews.Author: Scotty5050
Reviews.Content: The Good... The View, The Bed, The location, The neighborhood, The price The Bad... Nothing too bad The Ugly.... Everything past the front door. It is in dire need of a renovation. This could be a very good hotel, if they would spend some money on fixing it up.

Reviews.Title: “Only mildly disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: soriguana
Reviews.Content: my sister and i stayed for 5 nights. we switched to a room with a different view the 4th night. city views are spectacular. probably the most comfortable hotel bed i have slept on. prompt room service. room was clean. staff nice, friendly. great fitness room machines. the room needed to be repainted, badly. on entering the room the words 'well i guess it's ok' popped into mind. i guess you had to be there. i don't know how much this cost but i am sure it was too much. please don't go here on your honeymoon. the mood is all wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: stpbecky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to NYC in June for our 5th anniversary, and we booked the Millennium UN Plaza on Priceline. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and the view of the city from our room was amazing. The staff was polite. We did have to wait a few hours to check into our room, but I wasn't surprised since we arrived well before check in time. The value was good for NYC in the summer, in my opinion. The hotel a bit out of the way and it is several blocks from the subway, so be prepared to walk a ways or take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The Penthouse circa 1980”
Reviews.Author: Shamyrasexy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were extremely excited to stay in the Millenium UN Plaza Hotel and couldn't wait to see our penthouse suite. To our suprise our room was very outdated circa 1980's chic. The view of the east river was great and the size was sufficient for two ladies but given the reputation and the location of the hotel we expected upgraded luxury- at least from the new millenium. Overall our stay was plesent, the staff was wonderful and our holloween weekend was greatl. We got an amazing sleep and the room was sufficient but lacking the wow factor of the Penthouse suite.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds, nice views, bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Roxi
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we had to wait a few hours for a room, not exactly what you expect from this sort of hotel. We were a group of four travelling together wanting two double rooms next to each other - this seemed to be the problem. They offered us a suite, and after reading reviews on tripadvisor decided to look at it before saying yes, it wasn't over nice; not exactly what you would expect from a suite. So we decided to wait it out for two double rooms. We were eventually given two rooms next to each other on the top floor. Amazing views, spacious bathrooms, very comfortable beds, massive tv. The only downside being that there is no tea and coffee facilities, so we had to go without. The overall feel of the hotel is that it is for business people, and has hardly any tourists. There is no friendly atmosphere, or helpful staff waiting to help you. Have definatley stayed in better within manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in the NYC”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderL
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room on the 35th floor. The cleaning ladies where super nice The receptionists where not the best they mumbled when they spoke and they where very cold, not very customer orientated.

Reviews.Title: “Reserved thru Hotwire and upgraded to the penthouse suite!”
Reviews.Author: avalongrp
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find the nicest reservation agent who chatted with us while he was checking us in. After a minute or so, he's combining our reservation for two rooms to one suite...on the top floor...with windows that opened, literally, on to the most amazing view of the skyline and on the other side, of the East River. All of the staff with whom we interacted were friendly and helpful and the beds, without a single bedbug, were sooo comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located and I can't say what our initially reserved rooms would have been like, but I can say, staying at the Millennium was a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible views, great location”
Reviews.Author: KerryScottt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room on the 37th floor of the UN Millennium Plaza Hotel for our honeymoon and enjoyed the experience immensely. Our room had stunning city and East River views and was very well appointed, including a huge comfortable bed and a large TV. The only downside was we were given a smoking room that smelled strongly of cigarettes even though we had requested a non-smoking room. We used the gym during our stay and it too was wonderful. The equipment is state-of-the-art and the views stunning. The indoor pool had equally amazing views. Staff were pleasant and polite, and were quick to help us solve some internet problems we had. The hotel is conveniently located in midtown Manhattan and easy walking distance to many tourist attractions. The only down side is that the hotel was quite expensive, and yet still charged through the nose for internet and other amenities other establishments provide free or charge.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wldhrsz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a huge disappointment. We booked 2 room and called to have them on the same floor. We were instead offered a 2 bedroom suite. We asked how the suite was and was told it was a great upgrade from our booking. It was 2 bedrooms, but way oudated. Not a picture on the walls, the kitchenette wasn't stocked with even a cup the carpet torn and filthy. No coffee maker, we requested one and was brought one, but the coffee never replenished. The views of the East River were great but the accommadations weren't. Would not stay here again for the same money. No wifi or internet without a fee. VERY disappointing and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “great in all the things that matter”
Reviews.Author: Koro
Reviews.Content: OK, the decor is dated, very dated, especially the bathrooms, which does make it seem less than sparkling clean. But the beds are fantastic, great mattresses, and cozy duvet covers instead of those icky bedcovers that are never washed. We were upgraded to a suite instead of 2 individual rooms and it was fantastic. The views were absolutely unbelievable. The pool was nice and warm, not huge but fine for an hour's diversion, especially with kids, and also had views. Did not have breakfast there. The service was friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous city view”
Reviews.Author: CherylBruce
Reviews.Content: Overall a wonderful experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was nicely appointed and clean. The bed was comfortable. The best part was the wonderful view of both the city and the East River. In one view we could see the Empire State building, the Chrysler building, the UN, the river, and much more. Only advice: time to start taking down all those mirrors!

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, spacious, quiet”
Reviews.Author: DinaKNewYork
Reviews.Content: The room was really large and quiet--both unusual for NY hotels. I had a great sleep here--bed, pillows, shower--all great. I would recommend this place for people who want to stay in Manhattan but dont want to deal with the crowds and street noise of midtown. The location on 1st Ave is a bit out of the way but I think it's worth the trade off.

Reviews.Title: “the best experience”
Reviews.Author: tracy023
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in New york. We made reservations by internet, and everything was OK. The view from our room (38 floor) was awesome!!! We could see the Empire State , the Chrysler and other fantastic buildings very close. I recommend visiting NY at least once in a lifetime. DonÂ´t miss it!!! And came to the Millenium !! The hotel is very nice, ecletic decoration, and it has a swimming pool with a fantastic view. The service was OK, and we had good transportation from there. Excelent location, within walking distance to Times Square, theaters, nightlife, and more... We loved New York!!! I canÂ´t wait to go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location , and amazing veiw”
Reviews.Author: 092110c
Reviews.Content: this was our first time in new york , we arrive and loved first immpresiion of hotel . we had a room over looking empire state and chrysler building , an amazing view , we also found the location good as was easy to get around , from there , the staff were very helpfull, we would def stay here again . tips- use the plaza deli for breafast , goos value and lot better than hotel [ blt bagel amazing ] only downside was housekeeping , room was cleaned everyday , but one night we had left a dirty glass on table , was still there following day , after room cleaned , not a big problem but ,still

Reviews.Title: “It's really too bad”
Reviews.Author: truthrater
Reviews.Content: in all sincerity, i don't ever take time to write reviews, but i have to say this is the worst hotel experience i've ever had, and i am a well traveled individual and have worked in the travel industry for some years. it is my hope that this review reaches the right reader so that action will be taken. after complaining about my accomodations i was given a very large discount for my stay. that should tell you something about the integrity of this review. well anyway, stayed here for 2 nights. was booked for 4 and only reason we stayed that long because many hotels were sold out for labor day weekend or had inflated rates, so we couldn't find anything until day 3. don't intend to be harsh, just completetly truthful. it's really too bad that the manager and/or owner doesn't take care of this hotel. it could be a very nice place to stay, as it has picturesque views, a decent pool, and an indoor tennis court, but it's obvious that there's no attention to detail, cleanliness, or comfort because simple fixes like windex, clean shower curtains, and a can of paint, wouldn't be a major expense and wouldn't be difficult be costly to implement, instead the hotel has chosen to sell rooms with filthy windows, grimy brown stained shower curtains, stained nasty fabric on the furniture, and yes, roaches. this hotel does not deserve a 4-star rating let alone any of your hard earned money$$$. A more honest assesment would be 1.5, and i would urge trip advisor to take another look at their rating system. a few compliments: the concierge, the bell hops, the switchboard operator, and most of the front desk staff were all very pleasant. i only wish they could find a place to work that would be worthy of their service. i could go on, but i'm sure you get the point. if you want nice views, and a dirty hotel, well you've found it. what a shame.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price we paid”
Reviews.Author: chgiroux
Reviews.Content: At less than $200/night (on sale), I can't complain much, and we only stayed one night. The lobby decor definitely is of the 70s/80s era--mirrors abound. The room we settled on in the 34th floor looked out to another hi-rise building, so we mostly saw windows. The said room, though updated in mostly maple wood and modern furniture, had a tired-looking bathroom, and didn't match the modern looking bedroom. It also smelled like cigarette smoke. We may have been given a smoking room. The first room they assigned us on the 33rd floor had a puddle of water surrounding the toilet and the room smelled of Clorox. The Front Desk immediately sent up a bellman with a key to our new room. That was appreciated. In terms of amenities, the room didn't have a coffee maker nor a small fridge, or even bathrobes. Their hair dryer is the kind that's installed on the wall, not good for someone with long hair like me. The shower tiles could use some Clorox cleaning. In terms of convenience, it's a short walk to Grand Central Station, which is why we chose this, since we were there for the US Open. Otherwise, the doorman and bellman were helpful. The concierge recommended a good brunch restaurant on 52nd, which we enjoyed. Over all, if you don't mind the comments I noted above, and if you get a low rate like we did, you may like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Afwul and disgusting experience”
Reviews.Author: MAS1968
Reviews.Content: I found a bug on mybed ( a centiped) and reported to a lady at the reception. She DID NOT CARE LESS. The check out was a nightmare for two reasons: 1) the bill was higher that what I had booked on the internet. This is because on mny arrival the hotel upgraded me WITHOUT ASKING ME so they wanted to charge me 60 USD more. The lady again DID NOT CARE LESS despite the fact that I had a print out of my reservation. I had to speak with the manager who was VERY DEFENSIVE and finally credited me for the 60 USD (already chargged by the receptionist who obviously was not listening to me while I was expleini g that the bill WAS WRONG!!!). Staff has an awful attitude. I work for the United Nations which is your primary client, just next door. I will share this information with all the people I know in the UN. The only nice person I have foudn is the doorbell man Mr Robert. The rest is crap!\ Even breakfast was an horrible experience. I went downstairs at 9am. The waiters stared to clean the buffet at 9:40 while I was still eating......VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Never again! I paid 330 USD for an 10 UDS experience. Max

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, Great View, Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Chinakaren
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel all around. The staff were incredibly nice, the view from the room was the best! Very comfortable bed. Very clean. Large size rooms for NYC. 10-min walk to Grand Central Station. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect views, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: ifik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 3627 which had amazing views to the East River and downtown Manhattan. Even though the room needs refurbishment it was quit discent and the cleaning stuff did an excellent job. The great disadvantage of the room is that the windows allow the noise from the central heating and cooling systems of the other buildings to come into the room. Every night we had to use earplugs in order to sleep. We did not request to change room because we loved the view...

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, exactly what u need for new york!!”
Reviews.Author: lowsvaughan
