Reviews.Content: i travelled to new york for a week for my birthday with my boyfriend, and what an amazing trip and the hotel was exactly what we needed - the room was huge and views were lovely, it was clean, tidy and the staff were very nice (we didn't really give much tips) and we still got a nice reception off the concierge every time we walked into the hotel. the bonuses of this hotel : that u have a swimming pool so u get to swim in the clouds watching all the helicopters hovering round......plus this hotel was on the grayline new york sightseeing tour stop under the UN sight seeing stop, so you can work your sight seeing rota this and the bus takes u right to ur hotel at the end of the day.......and there was a lovely little deli doors away from the front door which is open 24hrs for tea, coffee, hot choclolate and in the morning lovely breakfast bagels and lots of other choices. yeah the hotel dÃ©cor is a little bit on the tired side, but im there on holiday not to sit and wonder what wallpaper suits the place, so it didn't even bother me in the slightest!! great hotel, we will be back !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Blast from the Past - and not in the Good Way”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorNY
Reviews.Content: It was the mid-70s. A new hotel opened in New York just across the street from the UN. An eccentric hotel designer said, "This is my chance to decorate with 1000s of mirrors and lots of brass and chrome." Not much has changed much at the Millennium since then. On a recent business trip, I decided that I would give this hotel a try since it was just a block or two from my office in New York. I thought that this would be a well maintained hotel since it was across from the UN in a not-too-bad neighborhood in Midtown. The minute I walked in the lobby, I knew I had made a mistake. Although the staff was friendly, the lobby was worn-out and dated. It looks like they may have updated the lobby in the mid to late 80s. When I arrived at my room, I thought I had gone back 40 years in time. The fixtures and the furniture did not look like they had been replaced since the hotel opened in the mid-70s. Actually, the fixtures and furnishing may be older than that because it looked like my room was designed and built as a studio apartment. The room was outfitted with a sink, fridge, stove combination common in NY studio apartments. My guess is that this hotel used to be an apartment building that got a facelift on the outside. The carpet in my room was dingy and stained, and it matched the dirty and broken curtains. The linens on the bed were clean. The closet doors were broken and would not slide from side to side. The TV looked new. The windows were so small and dirty that it was hard to see the view that was touted in the hotel brochures. The shower/tub had good water pressure and plenty of hot water, but the floor felt a little slimy. This is one of those hotels where you somehow feel dirtier just walking in the room and you try as hard as you can not to touch too many things. I hope my next trip to NY does not include a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BigtimeGB
Reviews.Content: Was probably the best hotel I have stayed at in New York. This is based on the following: 1) Service was great 2) food and room service was very professional 3) Swimming pool with panoramic views of New York 4) 42 inch plasma in the room 5) Location is perfect Thats all I needed and a very good rate! BigtimeGB

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Wow wow wow!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Riam2
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We got upgraded and the room was just amazing. Really big, with a fabulous view of the Chrysler building and the Empire State (such a good view that we didn't have to bother bringing the kids to see them!). The staff are so good, especially the concierge and doormen. The hotel is being renovated and as such we had no tea/coffee maker in the room,and no minibar (there was a note stating that this was due to renovations) but we did have two very cosy bathrobes and a fridge. I think it may depend on which room you get. The bed was extremely comfortable (and I have a bad back and don't usually sleep well in hotels). The bath was on the small side but the bathoom itself was large. We really enjoyed our stay, and look forward to coming back and using the pool which we didn't get an opportunity to do this time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow..and that's just the upgrade !!!”
Reviews.Author: ragman1960
Reviews.Content: Soon as we arrived we got an upgrade..the View...Brilliant,everything just a short walk away..first class Hotel everyone was very Helpful,Only In New York for 4 days but got so much done it was Fantastic..well done to everyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still OK, but developing some patina”
Reviews.Author: MattBavaria
Reviews.Content: Coming back for the third or fourth time I have to say that over the last five to six years the hotel is getting older, bathroom tiles develop some greenish streaks, walls are full of suitcase scratches and the aircondition (well working) is on the noisy side. Minibars have been closed and no bathrobe was available to go to the pool. The bed was nice ina ppearance but creacking on any movement. The TV sound was not clear. The fitness center is being refurbished (no announcement on reservation). The location is still great, close to Grand Central station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location although slightly out of the main New York area”
Reviews.Author: nickip35
Reviews.Content: All of the staff that we saw whilst here were all fantastic & happy to help (apart from the older lady that works most evenings in the gift shop). It was only about 15 mins walk from Grand Central Station. The swimmiong pool was lovely although a little cold. If you can get a room on a high floor this is recommended, we were on the 37th floor & had a view of the East River & Empire, Chysler Building. The only down side to the hotel is the amount of mirrors, they are everywhere (although I could think this as I do not like mirrors)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: HJenThomas
Reviews.Content: Visit this hotel in july 2010. Room was on the 33th floor. Great view of the Empirestate and Crysler building ! Spacious room (in New York !!). Staff was okay good service. We could leave our suitcases on our last day so we could visit the city before leaving to the airport. Reallt value for money. Wouldn't mind staying there again !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smudgerDarlington
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. We went for our friends 50th birthday, and as we checked in Barry on reception upgraded her room as a birthday present. When we got to her room it had a panaramic view of the east river on one side and the Manhatten sky line on the other side. Swimming in the hotel pool was an experience, swimming on the 27th floor looking out of a glass frontage overlooing the Manhatten sky line AMAZING. Barry on reception and Robert on the front entrance were both very nice people and very informative and helpful. Would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tcordero
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviews...hotel is a few blocks from Grand Central, but from there, you can get anywhere. Great views from the room, we had a corner room with views of the East River and Empire State Building. My only complaint of the room, was that if you were there in the middle of the day, the room got really, really hot even with the AC on full blast. Otherwise, by NYC standards, pretty roomy...you do have to pay for internet. We opted not to since we had our iPhones...got internet no prob via 3G. Food at the hotel way overpriced. Had breakfast right up the street at John's Cafe, a little diner...fed the whole family for less than $30. Brought back pizza from Little Italy's Lombardi's for dinner another night. One thing I have to praise about the hotel is the safe neighborhood. We'll be back...especially if they renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal staff, incredible views, spacious..”
Reviews.Author: dtc109
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a tiny space and to not spend much time in the hotel at all. Lucky for us, this hotel surpassed our expectations and then continued to impress. We were greeted upon arrival by the most geniunely friendly man (Tim) and then throughout the trip, everyone was so kind and personalized our experience. Amazing coffee place just up the street (Macchiato Bar) and Grand Central just a few blocks away. Long way to say "a great location". Internet is pretty pricy, but we'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room, housekeeping, service”
Reviews.Author: Nickalex
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, we were upgraded to a junior suiteâ€”great! There was a bedroom with TV and bath plus a sitting area with TV and bath. The 32nd-floor view of the East River was wonderful. Then we found the room had a broken TV and two lamps with burned-out bulbs, which an engineer repaired when called. Also we found a broken hinge on the cabinet door, broken plastic coverings on two ceiling lights, a broken glass counter in the bedroom, and a very slow drain in the sink and tub. Two sofas had upholstery that was ripped, tattered and dirty. There was a distinct odor of cigarettes, although we had not been promised a non-smoking room. In my opinion, Room #3205 should be out of service until repairs are completed. As for Housekeeping, my washcloth was taken and not replaced; there was dirt in the bathtub; a coffeemaker was brought to the room and the chambermaid didnâ€™t wash the coffee pot or cups or clean the filter. Credit cards were sent to me in care of the hotel, and tracking showed they were delivered the morning we arrived, a Saturday. I talked to different people at the desk and all insisted they were not to be found. One told me he had a log of everything received and they had not been delivered. On Monday they showed up, misplaced by whoever received them. The hotel has a pool, a fitness center, a bar and restaurant, and WiFi. In-room WiFi costs $12.95 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: Essie2211
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Millennium UN Plaza in New York for 3 days on the second leg of our visit to the US. On the first leg,, when we first arrived in the US, we were at the Hilton Garden Inn which we found less than we had expected, so we thought we would give the Millennium a try at the end of our journey before we flew back to Singapore. We were delighted to have made the change! At check-in, we were quickly ushered into our room by a friendly and informative bell man and when we entered our room, we found that it was very spacious and not just by New York standards. The beds were divine and because we had a corner room, we had a wonderful view of the city, beginning with the Chrysler building. Every room is on a high floor and all rooms come with a view. One drawback about this hotel that they can't do anything about is that it is a bit of a walk to the nearest subway station. Another minus, and this is something that the hotel management can do something about, is that the rooms do not come with free wi-fi. All in all, though, this is a good hotel and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service. Great view. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: SWCHAN
Reviews.Content: I stayed just last week and would stay again soon. The staff are wonderful. Everyone was helpful, cheerful, and made you feel they really care. The upgraded room at 40th floor was huge and the view was nice. Only drawback is that the windows are a bit small and the bathroom not very well replensihed. Love the gym and pool as most guests do. The neighbourhood is quiet and safe. Nothing touristy about it at all. Will happily recommend it to friends. And if the rooms are renovated i would rate it 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: GAK12
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a four (4) night stay. Secured the room through Priceline; $152 per night plus tax. Our room view was spectacular (Rm#3836). There was no need to pay for the observation deck at the Empire State Building or at Rockefeller Center. Room size was large for N.Y. standards, a/c worked great. room needed some updating, especially the carpets; had stains. Not a bad walk to Grand Central in the morining, but after a long day of walking the city, you might wish the station was closer to the hotel. Staff was courteous.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel, very pleasant staff who could not do enough for you......”
Reviews.Author: mpatelSurrey
Reviews.Content: We were not looking forward to staying in the hotel after reading some of the reviews but we can honestly say that we loved everything about the hotel. It is a bit further away from tourist areas eg Times Square but taxis we found were very reasonably priced and grand central subway was only 10 minutes walk. The gym and swiming-pool facility were available but we didnt get a chance to make use of them.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Foxy2
Reviews.Content: We were planning to stay over after seeing a show, and I scoured the internet looking for a deal. I came upon the Millenium UN Plaza with a rate of $159 (plus tax) that I could not believe! Upon checking the TA site, I found that some loved it; others did not. I decided to take a chance, and we were very pleased with our choice. The room is very large, with a king size bed and a large flat-screen TV. The bed was comfortable, and the room was spotlessly clean. We encountered a problem in the morning with the hair dryer, that kept turning off, and the shower that had only luke-warm water. We reported it to the staff when checking out, and she made a call immediately to housekeeping to have the problems corrected. The neighborhood is quiet and safe. We were in NY on Memorial Day weekend, and the streets in the theater district were teeming. When we returned to our quiet haven on the east side, we felt relieved and happy we were there. This is the hotel we will stay in on our visits to the city. One note - many reviewers talk about the spectacular views, but we had a straight-on view of the building next door. We were in room 3301, so if a view is important to you, I would suggest that you not stay in this room. If you looked off to the left, you could see the skyline, but at first glance, all we could see was the building next door. Having stayed in NY many times, this was not important to us, and we did not ask to change our room. We passed on the breakfast buffet ($24.95 a person) and walked up to the corner of 44th & 2nd to John's cafe. We had a great breakfast for a total of $25 for both of us. We also had lunch at the Amish Market on 45th between 2nd and 3rd. They had a good variety of sandwiches, and they were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TheScubaDuo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location 10 minutes walk from Grand central station, 20 minutes walk from the Empire state building. All other locations within easy reach via the subway. Rooms are large we had a corner room but did NOT face the Empire State building which we requested. The hotel is very well presented and clean with very good staff. There is a Deli at the top of the block for coffee and food. (Internet is NOT free)

Reviews.Title: “great location for UN business, needs some updating, though”
Reviews.Author: lupo_mm
Reviews.Content: This month I stayed again at the Millenium UN Plaza. It's key selling point is its location right next to the UN HQ and still within walking distance to most UN offices now that many have moved out during the refurbishment of the HQ building. The Millenium is solid, but it really does begin to show its age. Carpets in the rooms are worn, stains abound on wallpaper, etc. and much of the equipment date from the early 90s, although there flatscreen TVs in the rooms now. Room size is okay for NY. As long as you get a room on the upper floors (30+), the place is definitely still worth staying at because the views are amazing. If you are a tourist, I would recommend asking at booking for a room that is above the 35th floor and looks out towards mid-town. The view is spectacular. You can even open the windows up there. In all, if you can get a reasonable price (<$250) then I would recommend this place to business travellers and tourists alike. Forget about the breakfast, though. There are plenty of cheaper and better places just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jvdp11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. It was a pleasant stay. We got a room with view over Manhattan. 10 minutes walk to grand central. Staff was very friendly. Unfortunatly the internet wasn't free.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt for staying anywhere else now - can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: AnnieH53
Reviews.Content: We stayed in twin and kingsize rooms on the 34th floor having been given free upgrades on arrival. We had stunning views from the windows - I was able to go to bed looking at the coloured lights on the Empire State building each night The rooms were exceptionally clean - the beds were freshly made each day and were extremely comfortable. On previous visits to the City staying in different areas of Manhattan I had always been kept awake or woken up by noisy sirens and dust carts collecting the rubbish from the streets but it was very relaxing being able to gaze at the view yet not be bothered by any traffic noise at all. All the staff were very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Staying at the hotel enhanced our visit and at the end of a long day visiting the sights it was a joy to return to the room and sink into the wonderfully comfortable beds. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip even better”
Reviews.Author: annemcglone
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed at the Millennium UN Plaza in February 2010 for 4 days. The room was a great size with the most amazing views of the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building and much more. The TV wasn't working when we first arrived but was up and running within the hour thanks to the friendly and helpful staff. The concierge was a fountain of knowledge and always glad to help. Yes, I would agree that it was a bit far away from Times Square but to me the whole point of being in New York was to walk around and take in the sights and once we bought travel passes for the tour bus we discovered there was a stop right at the hotel. This was a great trip and the hotel was great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great views!!”
Reviews.Author: deyoljm
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was great. We had a corner room on the 34th floor and the view was amazing. The room was also very clean and quiet. The bed was large and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I also loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kkrai16
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel room was very spacious, clean and had fantastic room had the corner room on the floor 30 and it was lovely. Nice large Samsung tv, hairdryer etc. included. Can't fault the hotel. The only slight problem was the distance of the hotel from times square was a long walk especially with children but had this hotel been more central we would have paid more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Scillyboy
Reviews.Content: Had a room on the 38th floor, which I think was the top floor and the view was wonderful. Ask for a room with a view otherwise you may be lower down and "facing the wrong way" On checking in I asked for a room with a view and it was no problem. We could see right down to the Financial District and out to sea, as well as the Empire State and the Chrysler Building. The staff were all very helpful. The hotel room was a good size and comfortable enough. It is looking a bit dated and could do with a "lick of paint" but overall it was better than good. The breakfast in the hotel was expensive and had a poor choice. Go up the road 100 metres to "Johns" cafe on the corner of East 44th and 2nd Avenue for a cheap good quality and value breakfast. Very safe neighbourhood and a comfortable 8 - 10 minute walk to Grand Central for the subway.

Reviews.Title: “The views are the only plus.”
Reviews.Author: mrsmedina
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel through Priceline, and am really glad I got a decent rate. I'm still not thrilled that I paid $140/nt for this place - but since I didn't get to choose, oh well. This place is DATED. I mean, bad. Our room, on the 31st floor was only about 1/4 furnished (one table and one chair and a whole lot of empty space). The carpet was coming up in the corners, the medicine cabinet in the bathroom was full of rust, etc. The bedding was really nice and the beds were comfortable. The views were OUTSTANDING. Seriously breathtaking. I didn't mind the fact that the hotel was away from the trains, as the walk to GCS wasn't too bad. I also don't agree with previous reviewers who said there isn't much in the area. There is, it's just a short walk away. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again. The rooms are in desperate need of refurbishing and until then, I'll stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best value”
Reviews.Author: Tatirj
Reviews.Content: First, we found an excellent promo and the hotel was cheap for us. Second, we have a baby so when we arrived there, in the first time, the attendent lent me a stroller (I didn`t need buy one). The staff were friendly and helpful. We had some problems with UPS and they tried to resolve our question. The room was clean, quiet and big. Finally I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikolaoug
Reviews.Content: the location off the hotel it was perfect,the stuff very friendly the room very clean and with amazing view!i liked also spa and gym in 27 floor

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but not up to star rating”
Reviews.Author: SomervilleReisender
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a Priceline bid. Because it was a rainy few days, I found it a bit far from Midtown via bus - no subway lines nearby. The hotel is just across from the UN and several embassies surround it. Not many stores or restaurant choices nearby. The hotel itself looks modern on the outside but is showing signs of wear inside: tears in the hallway wallpaper, scuff marks and scratches on furniture in the room, etc. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. However, I came back one evening to hear the Bellman verbally browbeating several guests who were looking for a cab. He was harsh and abrasive and just plain rude. Internet seemed quite pricey at $12.95 per day! Overall it was a pleasant stay, but I wouldn't rush back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CtPaddler
Reviews.Content: Not much to say. It is a beautiful modern hotel in New York City. Pricey, but I got a decent discount from a hotel web site. The subway is not close, you will need to use the bus, cab, or feet to get to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Stan_Cooper
Reviews.Content: After the volcano erupted last week, I had to throw together a last-minute vacation to replace five nights in France. I won this hotel on priceline.com in order to go see a few shows and take in some sights with my girlfriend. The hotel is clean, safe, and not too far to walk many places downtown New York. We found the room was comfortable and adequately equipped, although I found it somewhat unusual that there was no coffee maker in the room. Also the bed frame didn't seem that sturdy. North of the hotel about four blocks on UN Plaza is a small joint called Choux Factory where we found a quick bite for breakfast, which I recommend to fuel up before a long day of walking. $12 bought two breakfast rolls and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Usually a great hotel... but not this time.”
Reviews.Author: FormerNYTHotelCritic
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in this hotel happily for many years, since before it was a Millennium or Regal. But this time was different. I woke up in the middle of the night when my girlfriend went to the bathroom, and I was surprised to see, by the light filtering through the bathroom door, a small roach crawling along the bed next to me. Then, in the morning, we were away from the room for five minutes... but housekeeping entered (before 10 am) and tossed it, though we hadn't checked out! My very polite complaints upon checkout were met by a promise from the assistant manager to fumigate the room, but no compensation whatsoever - and this for a 12-year customer. If you go and get room 3221, ask if it has been fumigated!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: jsprks
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 7 night stay at this hotel and was happy with the overall experience. The hotel is well located, no more than 25 minutes walk to central park and most other landmarks, less than 15 to 5th Avenue. First impressions of the building is good, when you first enter you get your bags checked by sniffer dogs, which are adorable I must add! Which shows the hotel cares about its own reputation and its customers well being. The reception area is great, with mirrored ceilings and marble walls. There are four lifts, so you donâ€™t have to wait too long to get to where you want to go. The room we paid for was a superior king room which turned out to be two standard rooms in one; giving it a separate living room and bedroom as well as two bathrooms all well furnished and decorated. Both the living room and the bedroom had large 40â€�+ TVâ€™s. Living room had a fold out sofa bed should you need it and additional wardrobe with free safe inside. Bedroom had king-size bed, built in wardrobe and separate bathroom. Both the living room and bedroom had windows across the wall, which had fantastic views, which are probably standard in every room, on the East building, as the rooms are all above the 28th floor, so beware if you are afraid of heights! We didnâ€™t use the gym but we did go in the pool, once. I was quite disappointed as the pool was really cold, which I wouldnâ€™t mind in the Caribbean but in New York, no. However, the views from the pool area were very nice, overlooking the UN building with the Chrysler building in view. The changing rooms to the gym/pool had saunas, but this meant there were separate saunas for males and females. The hotel also has tennis courts on the 38th floor. If you are hungry donâ€™t bother with hotel meals, the first night we ordered room service (a small pizza, fries and a bottle of wine) costing $90. We also had the breakfast buffet in the hotelâ€™s restaurant, The Ambassadorâ€™s Grill, which was equally expensive. For two people at the breakfast buffet, cost $60. The buffet was nice, but wasnâ€™t a lot, especially in terms of cooked breakfast items. We did find two restaurants close by, which had really good food, for good prices. We used Johnâ€™s (corner of 44th and 2nd) as our breakfast base, tea and coffee is free, staff constantly coming round to refill your mug, and the pancakes were to die for. $15 for two people to have pancakes with free hot drinks, you really canâ€™t complain and Deanâ€™s (2nd Avenue between 42nd and 43rd) which did really good Italian food, lunch specials costing just $11 each and evening meals about $15 per person. Overall the hotel was a good choice, as we really enjoyed our stay; I really miss my ears popping every time we went in the lift!

Reviews.Title: “Will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: fruhansen
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms, tidy and clean. Decent sized room with a great view. Helpfull staff, and a safe neighbourhood. Will defenitly choose this hotel next time I visit NY. Nearby everything in midtown, downtown. I recommend this for everyone who is visiting NY:)

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: WJ60
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. Nice rooms, great views, terrific pool and fitness room and accomodating staff. i arrived very early on my last stay and they bent over backwards to accomodate me with a room as soon as one became available as I was very tired after a long flight. Doormen always pleasant. Nice neighborhood, yes a 5-7 minute walk to subway but the location is in a "neighborhood" and that is nice sometimes too.

Reviews.Title: “With views like this, who cares?”
Reviews.Author: gogringa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a week on a corner room on the 38th floor. The view is like a postcard- the Chystler Building and the Empire State fill your frame. A little out of the way because it is so far east but the service was excellent. One major complaint - the internet connection is $13 a day and slow. Wi Fi is worse- $13 for 30 minutes and then you are cut off. The Internet cafe is run as a concession and is 50 cents a minute! In this day and age, this is abusive. But the views!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Star”
Reviews.Author: Sunsnowfamily
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very conveniently located right next to the UN. Safety is excellent. Concierge is very knowledgable and will provide recommendations and make reservations for all activities and price choices. Small gym, but sufficient. No restaurant currently, but then when you have such an excellent concierge who would want to stay in the Hotel? May be able to spot a celebrity here, just make sure you know them, because the staff is very discreet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views”
Reviews.Author: iscream4life
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip through hotwire. We booked a king bed and requested a city view. Not due to the hotel's fault but we ended up with a full size bed. They claimed it was Hotwire's fault. The desk workers seemed a bit snotty. We got a small room with a kitchenette and the view was the city and the river.The hotel looks a bit dated. The cons of this hotel is the housekeeping. They make the bed and I think that is it. I dropped some cereal by mistake and it was still there when we returned after sightseeing all day. My husband requested a sewing kit and it took a hour to get it. The walls are paper thin and we could hear people in the other room. The gift shop is very small and expensive. I would suggest going down the street to the drug store if you need anything. The cashier didn't ask my husband for id when he used a credit card but demanded I show an id! I refused. The bar down in the basement is pretty goofy. It looks like a maze with all the glass. The drinks are very expensive and watered down. The business center is next to the bar and consists of three computers and they charge alot for printing. My husband forgot to read the screen first, you can print out your flight stuff for free. Oops! The pros: This hotel was located in a prime spot and easy to walk to other attractions. The bed was very nice and the room although small was lovely. The doormen and hotel manager were very helpful and nice. All in all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ski_bum72
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the Millenium UN Plaza booked through Expedia. I got what I believe to be a great deal at under Â£500 p/p for 4 nights with BA flights from LHR to JFK. The hotel is in a fantastic location, 10 mins walk to Grand Central and 15-20mins to Times Square. We stayed in the West Tower on the 38th floor with views east to Queens, Brooklyn & Long Island. Would have preferred Manhattan views but the receptionist said they were too full to allow (however she did put us in the West Tower at our request). The room itself was very large with a wonderful clean king sized bed, and a 50 inch plasma TV. The bathroom, although a little dated was clean, so we had no complaints. We deliberately avoided eating in the hotel, not because of the reviews on here but just because we wanted to sample real New York breakfasts in authentic surroundings rather than the glitzed up hotel restaurant. Note that the restaurant, the "Ambassador Grill", only serves breakfasts and not dinner. We found John's Diner just up the road on the corner of 2nd Ave and 44th St to be a great fantastic location for breakfast where we got two full breakfasts with coffee and juice for the price of one continental breakfast in the hotel. There is also a nice deli on the corner of 2nd & 43rd that does great egg and bacon toasted bagles to go ($7.50 for 2 bagles and 2 coffees!) The hotel staff were always courteous to us. I had a drink in the bar on night and had a great chat with the friendly barman. The pool complex has views that are second to none. Ok so this isn't the Waldorf Astoria but it is not an expensive hotel and I think provides great value and location for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but WOW what a view”
Reviews.Author: stpauligirlmn
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 32nd floor, in a corner room. There where windows covering two walls. I could lay on the bed and look out at the Empire State Building. Out the other bank of windows, I had a beautiful view of the river and the bridge. The views were simply incredible. The hotel, on the other hand, was barely average. The room was dated and the bathroom was poorly maintained. There were crushed tiles in the bathroom that left divots in the floor. This was a real tripping hazard. The bathroom was clean, but very worn down. The bed was comfortable and clean. I ordered room service and the food was extremely expensive and really lousy. I had a $16 soggy vegetable wrap and a $5 diet coke. I would not recommend the food. For the view, this place is spectacular. For the price, the hotel's age is showing. I would definitely stay again - just for the view!

Reviews.Title: “Slept Great, Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: clocoboogie
Reviews.Content: Compared to a lot of hotels in Manhattan, the room was very spacious. Bathroom was huge and covered in mirrors (see pic). Flatscreen tv had a bunch of channels, picture was crystal clear. Bed was extremely comfortable and once I got in I didn't get up. Go check out the swimming pool if you get a chance, it looks like it does in the pictures with the amazing views. They also have a small gym but it felt like the heat was on when I was in there. Right near the UN, I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad service and charged me twice!”
Reviews.Author: mcwill7
Reviews.Content: On a trip with some friends to New York we booked ourselves in this hotel and stayed for a week. At the time I thought it was overpriced for the quality of the room and the service - although I admit it has great views over Manhattan. A year later, out of nowhere and for no apparent reason I was charged $510. The hotel had charged me for my stay a second time, without any authorisation (the money had been paid in full and taken from my account before we even stayed there a year before). When I checked in, they had told me to give them a card print for any 'incidentals' incurred to the room. So a year later they used my card print, without my knowledge and took money out of my account. When I contacted them to tell them what happened they were very cagey and unhelpful. After 2 months and a bit I got a refund but the pound had fluctuated quite a lot and I lost Â£30 in the whole story. When I pointed that out, I was completely blanked by their management. I wouldn't recommend staying in this hotel, their customer service skills are abysmal and their ethics are quite dubious.

Reviews.Title: “Millenium UN Plaza - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gerrym111
Reviews.Content: I have just returned home from a 6 day stay in NYC staying at the Millenium UN Plaza Hotel with my wife and parents. This hotel was perfect - our rooms on the top floor of the west tower were very spacious, clean and very well presented. I have travelled to New York many times but this was my first time staying at this hotel and I will be sure to use it every time I return. The views were spectacular and the staff were extremely friendly and could not do enough for us. The bathrooms were very nice and the beds were also very comfortable. The only slight problem we had was our room was an ajoining one and we could hear the two very loud ladies constantly talking at the top of their voices next door. This however was nothing to do with the hotel as they can't control rude manners from some of their guests who have no respect for other guests trying to sleep. Some reviews have said that the hotel is far away from things but everything is so spread out in New York it would be impossible to find a hotel close to everything. Grand Central Station is a 10 minute walk away where you can get the subway to anywhere you want to go. I would definately recommend this hotel to family and friends and will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, great view”
Reviews.Author: atlanta14
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once before several years ago and remember the room being quite small but simple and clean. This time around, the room we had was very large by NYC standards and we had an amazing view. The room was clean, and the hotel was quiet. While there is nothing amazing about it, we had a great stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Decrepit rooms, nice view, unionized employees not allowed to work....”
Reviews.Author: perls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Millennium for a week. The room was falling apart ... stains on couches, many of the hinges of the cabinets were broken. It's strange they can't bother to have someone come up and spend 30 minutes on simple stuff like this. My guess is that this place doesn't make a lot of money for the Millennium company, so they've decided to run it as cheaply as possible and let the rooms break down..... The staff were all really nice -- I want to be clear about that. Really helpful actually. We kept losing our keys and they always made us new ones.... Here were some issues we had: 1) The housekeepers will clean your room, but they won't touch your dirty dishes. When we inquired, we were told that union rules dis-allowed housekeepers to do dishes. Never heard that one before..... Funny to come back and find the room sparkling clean but a pile of dirty dishes in the sink..... 2) The pool is beautiful, but it closes down at 6 PM every day except Friday and Saturday, which will render it useless for those who stay here and do stuff during the day. The lifeguard union in NYC is notoriously strong, so I assume they make it expensive to keep it open to normal hours. 3) We rented a big suite -- and paid upwards of $450 a night for it -- we had a full kitchen, but it was like pulling teeth to ask housekeeping to deliver any usable cookware. In the end we had to go buy a pot and knife ourselves, as they refused to provide us with a decent one. The kitchen worked well -- but be fore-warned that you should treat this like a camping trip and bring your own stuff. There's a dishwasher, but they will refuse to provide you with dish detergent if you ask. (We did.) Otherwise -- the view was great, the kitchen basically worked, the room was big for the price........

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fab views!”
Reviews.Author: tashii26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in February and really enjoyed it. The staff and concierge were so lovely and friendly! Yes the rooms need a bit of tlc and modernisation but this would not put me off staying here again. The rooms are huge for Manhattan standards! There are a few stains on the carpets and the tiles in the shower not to mention ceiling in the room need a re-furb but overall it was comfortable, clean and housekeeping did a good job everyday. Unfortunatly the minibar is no longer in use which is a little sad. The one bad thing about the room was that there was no tea or coffee facilities, which is standard in most hotels. We stayed in the East tower and the views over the east river and midtown Manhattan were breathtaking, especially at night! The bed was comfortable and clean. TV and heating in find working order. The pool on the 27th floor is fabulous, nice to sit up there on the deck chairs with a good book and enjoy the sun and the brilliant views of both the Empire State and Chrysler buildings! There is no spa, but there is a gym and a sauna. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel, the restaurant doesnt seem to run like a proper restaurant, but you can go in there and order a proper meal and desserts. The bar has a nice selection of drinks but all is a bit overpriced. Go to Benvenuto Grille on 150 East 44th Street (between 3rd and Lexington) the service was brilliant and so was the food! The hotel is a good distance from everything, Grand Central Station, Empire State, TImes Square and Rockefeller Centre. Try walking where you can as theres so much to see! id recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, could have stared for hours!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleOsborne31
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about this hotel as our holiday approached with more and more people writing about the cleanliness, but to be honest, a few marks on the wallpaper here and there are just petty things to comment on when this hotel has such fantastic views. We stayed in the east tower on the 33rd floor, and had a south facing (downtown) view of the east river, downtown, the empire state building and the chrysler building. It was fantastic. Yes, it isn't the newest or most recently refurbished of hotels but our furniture was simple, bed was huge and so comfy, with fresh clean bedding and clean bathroom. Walking to grand central to get anywhere was ok, although perhaps if we were to go in January again we would stay closer to a subway as we had temps of -7 degrees some days. Overall, it was a great base and if you can find a cheap deal like we did, well worth it, just for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Plush Hotel - more for professionals”
Reviews.Author: Malfie
Reviews.Content: My family (including my young sister and brother) stayed at ths hotel in August 07 on a trip to new york. The hotel is very plush, fancily decorated and "posh" feeling - it all feels very mature and luxury. The location was fabulous - right by the UN building, Chrysler builing and Empire State. The rooms were very tidy and clean ith great views if you are on a higher floor. The indoor pool on the top floor was fine - nice floor to ceiling windows with great views as you swam. This hotel was really lovely the only thing I would say was that it didn't feel family friendly. It wasn't unwelcoming or unsitable for families - I just felt that it was more suited to professionals on business or childless couples - it had a very "grown up" feel. That's not to say we had a bad stay just that there are probably more family friendly hotels to stay in in new york. No restaurant on site and only one very small shop which sold a vey small selection of souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!!”
Reviews.Author: Mexicangreekgirl
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel befor, in 2003, and found it to be spacious, well maintained and averall a very good value for what I paid ($150 usd through a discount website), so I thought I'd give it another try for New Year's. We had stayed in the tower that's nearest to 1st ave, that was fine. On this occasion they booked us into the other tower, and it was less than great! The room itself was fine, except that the thermostat did not work, so even in freezing temperatures it was sweltering hot at night. The "kitchen" is not stocked at all, no toaster, utensils, etc., it just seems strangely out of place. The bathroom is too small and SO old!! Everything was moldy, the towels were threadbare, the garbage was never taken out. Then there was the incident with the comforter...On our third night there, the sheets which are on top and bottom of the comforter (it has no cover, just a top and bottom sheet) came apart and left the comforter uncovered. Imagine our surprise and DISGUST to see that there was a HUGE urine stain on the part that was near our heads!! I went down to the front desk and told the lady there about this, instead of offering an apology right away, she actually hinted that it may have been us that stained it!! She asked if we had just checked in, or why else had we just noticed the stain! I asked her to send someone up right away to change it, take out the trash, and leave more towels (we has a grand total of 2 threadbare bath towels). We were actually nice about it, careful not to make a scene, etc. We left for the day, when we came back, big surprise, NOTHING had been done. Our room had been made up, but I checked to see if the comforter had been changed and nothing!!I went down again, upset this time, asked to speak to the manager (he didn't seem very concerned about the problem)and they finally sent someone up to do it. The cleaning lady that came made a big deal out of the fact that my husband was smoking (smoking room), and she actually had someone else come in and do it for her while she gave directions from the door (smoke allergy, she said). She then examined the comforter and declared that she did not see a stain. I went over, turned on a light and pointed it out to her (VERY clear to see). She said that how could we know that it was urine, she didn't think it was (repeated this over and over). I have had toddler age kids, I Know what a bed wetting accident looks like. Aside from this fact, is she actually supposed to argue with the paying guests?!? They finally changed it, left, and, oh surprise, this one had stains all over it , too, except I don't think they were urine, they were dark brown in color. The whole thing was disgusting, I was upset that they made us jump through hoops to right a wrong, and the arguing was just too much. We payed about $300 usd a night on this occasion, and if you ask me, it was $300 usd too much. The lady at the room service line was also rude (shocker!). The manager wrote back to me after I answered a hotel survey and apologized, buyt it was too little, too late. This hotel soured my vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of East River!”
Reviews.Author: katrb
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wednesday 6th January at 1pm. In my direct booking with the hotel I specifically requested a smoking room and early check in. On arrival the receptionist said that only a non smoking room was available and was asking us to come back at 3pm. I got a bit flustered about our bags etc (it had been a long flight from Glasgow) and eventually she upgraded us to a smoking suite - room 3205 on the 32 floor. We arrived at the room and yes it was a suite, with 2 bathrooms, living room, 2 big televisions but it was a bit worn and weathered looking. We then spot the view - beautiful right out on to the east river across from the pepsi cola sign, down side is windows don't open - but we can live with that. Found some rubbish under a chair that hadn't been cleaned up by housekeeping - left it there for the duration of our stay and it still wasn't moved. The room was big, lots of space and bed comfy and the view was amazing, for what we paid I was happy. The location is two blocks away from Grand Central but that means you are only 2 blocks from the whole of New York, and there are a few eating places on 2nd/ 3rd avenue. We never ate at the Hotel, instead had breakfast at Madisson on 1st Avenue (10 minute walk but worth it). All in all a good hotel, don't expect a 5* hotel or room but a good option if you are a smoker as there are very few rooms left in New York that are smoking.

Reviews.Title: “tired but location very convenient to UN”
Reviews.Author: bodrumguy
Reviews.Content: my business is at the UN so convenient location. i am sitting in a superior king room now. need to look up 'superior' in my dictionary. walls are dirty and stained, cables running in open view, front desk said recently renovated. said would move me but the alternate equally drab. a picture was removed at some time and the outline and the hangers are still there sticking out next to the bed. nope, nothing superior about these surroundings. if you need to be near the UN and can find a a very good online deal, maybe...

Reviews.Title: “Cost effective/safe/comfortable choice for first visit to NYC...”
Reviews.Author: KAG1976
Reviews.Content: Room - we had a recently partly refurbished room that had a really nice comfy bed and a large TV. The bathroom needed a good detail clean - some yucky stains on the bathroom wallpaper etc. Bath tub was great for a hot soak in winter. Room was big enough to lay our large bags out on the floor and had a walk in style closet with heaps of hanging space for winter coats. Heating in room was good - we didn't feel the cold once. Big flat screen TV was great. My main gripe was that there was no coffee/tea making facilities in the room. We requested a coffee maker and got one however we had to call room service everyday to get a coffee sachet and milk brought up to the room. Plus - house keeping would not service the mugs or coffee area as part of their house keeping so we had to just make do. For a hotel which I am sure must attract a lot of UN staff and business travelers as well as tourists like us - surely coffee/tea in room facilities is a basic MUST!? Service - excellent. All staff we encountered we amazing. Room service was tasty and quick. Location - $5 cab ride to all the great immediate touristy spots or do like we did - a 10/15 min walk to everywhere we wanted to go. We found it very friendly and very safe. Value - we stayed over NYE (PEAK period) and it was by far the best price we could find in a hotel of decent standards. Very happy with the overall value. Would stay here again - especially if hotel ups the cleanliness standards and supplies the basic coffee/tea facilities!

Reviews.Title: “outdated but good value”
Reviews.Author: beachloverPrinceton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the millenium plaza during the new year's eve weekend (=peak season) and got the hotel at priceline for good value ($250/night vs > $400 for 2 star hotels). Upon arrival we were upgraded to a corner room on the 35th floor which indeed had absolutely awesome views of the city. The hotel is relatively well located, about 10 min walking from grand central in a quieter neighbourhood of NY, but you can also walk to times square or rockefeller center in about 20 min. While the hotel exterior looks good and gives the impression of a newer building, the hotel and rooms are old and definitely need renovation. The gym is small, pool is OK, "spa" in non-existent (literally a room with a massage bed). However, especially for us, the hotel was excellent value and if your purpose is seing the city and spending most of the time outdoor, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “An adequete hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AussieAwayFromHome
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 8 nights over Christmas/New Year 2009/2010. This was by far the cheapest hotel that we could find in New York, taking advantage of the 40% off advance purchase price online. The room had a nice view of the East River, was a decent size. Although the Hotel overall is quite dated and not exactly in a handy location being a 3 block walk from Grand Central Terminal (but you know this when you book the hotel), it is still quite adequate. The roof of the bathroom was mouldy and peeling, but this wasn't a big deal. In my opinion, compared to some of the other hotels I stayed in at much cheaper rates, this Hotel is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “East Side/West Side”
Reviews.Author: ftlouis
Reviews.Content: First time staying on east side of Manhattan. Buy a Metro Card at Grand Central and either walk to Grand Central for the subway or pick up the cross town buses at 2nd Ave and 42nd (hotel is on 44th). Wait for cabs can be 15 - 20 minutes from the hotel especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Large rooms, great views, friendly staff, away from Broadway/7th Ave hustle. Plenty of reasonable delis/restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: nikkig12
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hotwire so got a good rate, on arrival the receptionist said that if we would be happy to wait for an extra hour he would upgrade us to a room in the main tower. We got a room on the 31st floor with amazing views of the river, empire state and chrysler. The bed was so big and comfortable found it hard to get out of! The staff were very nice and friendly, decent bar in the basement. Location of the hotel perfect as near to everything but on the edge. Hope to stay again when we go again in the spring! One unexpected thing was the sniffer dogs on duty outside the hotel, but considering how near to the united nations the hotel is maybe this is a sign of the times. Lovely dogs by the way!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: bgrant99
Reviews.Content: No complaints. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and adequately sized. We were on the 36th floor and had a nice view of the skyline. It's within a couple of blocks of Grand Central. There are lot's of cool restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again, dated and dirty”
Reviews.Author: LizardAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We checked into a room that had not been updated, painted or fixed up in over 20 years. The views were great but the room was terrible. I complained and was moved to the newer tower that had a room that was updated 15 years ago. It had a huge stain on the carpet (neon blue), water stains in the bathroom and a hole in the bed covering. It was a mess. I had asked for non-down on my bed since I'm very allergic. I was told they didn't have non-down but they would send me a blanket. The blanket was literally falling apart. It took 2 more visits from housekeeping and about an hour and half to get an acceptable blanket. The location was good but I would never, ever stay here again. The management has not pride in their facility and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Coulden't Fault”
Reviews.Author: Avnon
Reviews.Content: I was slightly sceptical about this hotel on reading some of the reviews for this site, but like my previous New York hotel (which had similar reviews), I decided to go ahead and book. On arrival I was quite surprised on how much smaller the lobby was compared to my previous New York hotel (Grand Hyatt), but it certainly didn't make it any less of a hotel. We checked in about 6pm and was greeted by a very helpful and polite man named Adelin or something similar who upgraded us into a corner room with a kitchenette and an amazing view. The room was very nice and clean, large and had the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. The staff were extremely friendly, especially one of the valet's. Not sure on the name either but he was always wore a large coat outside, always asking us if we enjoyed our day and always stopped for a chat. The location of the hotel isn't that bad, you have to walk a bit further than a few hotels but we're only talking 5-10minute walk to Grand Central but there is always Taxi's outside ready for business. I didn't try the room service/hotel restaurant because I never normally will pay the prices but room service didn't seem THAT expensive. We got breakfast every morning from a little place on the corner of 44th + 2nd called Plaza Delhi which did the most amazing pancakes and bagels at really good prices (2 cream cheese bagels + 3 large pancakes with syrup + 2 large coffee's for $9.95). We didn't really try any of the hotel facilities such as the pool and gym etc, we planned to but didn't really find the time/didn't have the energy after walking around NY all day. I would definitely stay at this hotel again, we stayed over thanksgiving and we got a really good price for the hotel on a advance booking through their own site. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel....quite a walk to shops and sights”
Reviews.Author: michelle107
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful start to the hotel when we got an upgrade to a huge room (mini suite?) on the 39th floor. Fantastic views and very high....made sure I was really clear on where the emergency stairs were! Room was clean, staff really pleasant and pool/gym very good. My son and I had a wonderful time here except for the distance to the shops and sights. At first we walked up to Broadway and 34th Street etc but by the time we got there we already had aching feet. We then decided to just get cabs which was fine but the cost really started to mount up. If you stay here you really need to make sure you get to grips with the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: funkyrome
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, cheap price, best service...no other words!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view”
Reviews.Author: ET86
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s just an outstanding view onto the city out of the 31st floor. CouldnÂ´t imagine a better one.

Reviews.Title: “It was good.”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline and it worked out fine for us. The only issue was that it took a good 5-10mins to get to Grand Central and the subway. We arrived at 8am and couldn't get a room of course, they told us to check back at 12noon. By about 10am we we so exhausted from our red-eye flight we went back and gave our "sad faces" and got a room in the old tower on the 34th floor. It had a great view and was a large room based on NYC standards. I would say the service here was excellent all the way from Frank the bellboy to the rest of the staff. We did not eat here or use the pool, but everything else was fine. Our room was definitely showing some signs of wear and tear, but it was 100 times better than our previous hotels in NY (Best Western and Howard Johnson).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Millennium UN PLaza”
Reviews.Author: FinnishTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2009. We arrived late at night at got the room from the highest floor. We were really tired but we couldn't sleep beacuse of the ventilator on the roof - awful noise!!! Next morning, very tired, I went to reception asking a new room. The staff was very polite and promised to arrange us a new room by the end of the evening. Our luggage was moved in the evening. :) The staff in all was very helpful in every way and the hotel is clean. The location is not the greatest, but we had time so we didn't mind 5 minute walk to Grand Central Station everyday. If you stay shorter time, I wouldn't recommend because it's New York - you don't have time to waste! :) All in all, absolutely fantastic stay! I recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: “If u just want a great view of NYC and a simple room”
Reviews.Author: r0wee
Reviews.Content: Likes:less-traffic location, right off the highway to airports,and right opposite of the UN. The great morning and night view that can see sunrise in bed. heated pool with view on 27th floor. Very big corner room that you can open flatten-out large suitcases, decent beds and soft linens, but the bathroom was beyond old. Carpets needed to be changed though. Dislikes: staff (vvvery slow checking in, took me 30 mins coz there were only 2 staff even with a line of ppl) are rude and abrupt.... concierge was not helpful, not friendly enough even to recommend me anything. Just Q&A

Reviews.Title: “It was just o.k.”
Reviews.Author: tonib33
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Millennium at the UN Plaza whie visiting the city. I thought that over all the Hotel was nice enough, but had a few gripes. Size of the room-great, it was plenty large enough (as we were warned some hotel rooms in the city were super small). Views were good. Room-bed was awesome, one of the best I've ever slept on. The bathroom was outdated and needed renovation. Tub liner was peeling, drain stop was broken. We had a light fixture break (fall from the ceiling) while we were there. Location-Too far off the beaten path. We were blocks from Rockefeller Center and Times Square, and it felt out of the way to the more desireable areas. Staff-left a lot to be desired. Nobody was overly helpful. Concierge was awful. We asked about Broadway shows, told us that they used a broker for tickets so the prices ranged drastically, was not familiar with some of the restaurants we inquired about, nor did he seem interested in getting any info on them, had no recommendations for us, did not offer to make reservations to any of the attractions. They did have a fitness center which was small but efficent. Also had a pool, but it is designed for exercise not leisure, no spa (hot tub). Pool hours were very limited. They offered massage but it was not day spa type atmosphere. Due to the proximity of the hotel to the U.N. we expected that there would be a a lot of people there for business, which there were. The vibe was stuffy and quiet. If you are visiting for fun and to have a good time, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “useful hotel”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet074
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a 3 day whistle stop visit to new york. Very large rooms that were comfortable and had everything i needed. Found the staff a little rude and very abrupt but would not put me off returning. Very useful from its location and panoramic views of the city and found it surprisingly quiet considering its location. would definitely consider returning to it s it was what i have come to expect from a hotel of this nature.

Reviews.Title: “Still absolutely top-notch in every way”
Reviews.Author: NYCbacktoLAhooray
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the UN Plaza under various owners, and for various purposes, over the past twenty years. I recommended it to friends and family throughout the '90's and most recently in 2007. This was my first stay there in several years, and the recent traveler reviews had me a bit apprehensive. Those concerns were unwarranted based on our experience this past weekend. We arrived at the UN Plaza, following a red-eye flight from the West Coast, at 6:30 am. I'd called the day before to request early check-in, and was told that while the hotel would try to accommodate us, it would depend upon room availability, which made sense. While I had reserved a room with two beds, there was none available at that unGodly hour, and we were offered a room with a king-sized bed, on the top floor, which we gratefully accepted. It was absolutely beautiful. The room was spacious, nicely updated and redecorated, with spectacular, panoramic open views looking east to the United Nations, and south, down the East River, the FDR Drive, and First Avenue. We could see the bridges to the south, and the Empire State Building to the southwest. It was breathtaking. Being on the top floor meant that we were immediately below the roof-top tennis courts, which occasionally meant we felt like there were small children thundering down the hotel corridors. Nonetheless, we absolutely enjoyed our room and our four day stay at the UN Plaza. The staff was cordial, professional and helpful. Housekeeping was attentive and invisible. The beds and linens were beyond comfortable. We had a platform bed and wonderfully supportive mattress, with light-weight feather comforter that was cozy and warm without being oppressive. The UN Plaza is located in midtown, on the eastern-most edge, an easy walk to the subway at Grand Central Station, and even better for our purposes, between the First and Second Avenue buses which run north and south, respectively, and close to the cross-town 42nd Street bus, as well. There are always taxis available at the hotel or close by. Second and Third Avenues in midtown offer a wealth of restaurants of every variety within easy walking distance. While frequent City visitors know this already, the less-seasoned beware: current NYC hotel taxes (obviously applicable to all, not just the UN Plaza) can add $50, 60, 70 or more to already costly accommodations, and are not included in the room rate quote. I think that the UN Plaza offers terrific value in the four-star hotel category, and that the staff members at the front desk, bell staff, doormen, concierge and housekeeping could not have been more appropriate. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Million Dollar Views....OK Room and Location. Very quiet.”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: Decent Location Well sized room with average furnishings / condition Quiet Million $ views We used a well known hotel booking website and pre-paid for this 3 1/2 Star accomodation. We were not expecting too much from The Millenium U.N. Plaza. We knew the location would be on the far east side (between 1st and 2nd ave on 44th) and that we'd be walking a bit (which we actually enjoy quite much). Check in was smooth and courteous. Like I said, we weren't expecting much from our room, but when we opened the door to our room (3820) we were blown away. Not because the room was so great...but because of the million $ view of Manhattan. Truly breath taking (see pics) The room itself was well sized and impossibly quiet. We had friends staying at the Marriott East on the 15th floor and they said they heard every taxi horn all night. Our room at the Millenium had good A/C / Heat, a comfy bed, and a safe. There was a minibar cabinet, but it was locked. I went to the front desk and asked for a key, but was told they no longer provide that service. Might be a good idea to take the "mini bar" label off the cabinet. There was a fabulous pool and workout room on the 27th floor overlooking the U.N. and the East River. Didn't use it, but saw a family having fun. All in all, we were very satisfied, but if we had paid the "rack rate" I'm not sure if the million dollar view would have made up for the "slightly above average" quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Good location. Nice large room.”
Reviews.Author: SoxFanInVa
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through Priceline for 3 nights. We were given a corner room on the 38th floor in the west tower. The views were incredible. Out one window we could see the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building. Out the other window we had a view of the river and beyond. The hotel was clean, the room was large, and the bed was very comfortable. The walk to Grand Central Terminal was about 10 minutes. Not bad considering you are likely to do a whole lot more walking than that in NYC. No complaints and a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Liking this hotel less and less”
Reviews.Author: GrandGourmand
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the newer tower. As I was checking in, the receptionist tried to get me to change to the older tower ("Excellent views") - with hindsight that was a bit cheeky, since those rooms are cheaper. The good The room size is more than adequate for New York (or anywhere else). Relatively recently updated, the furnishings are both new and clean. The bathroom is fine. The bed is excellent if you like soft mattresses. The TV is a large, oldish LCD. The bad No minibar Room service at times convenient to the hotel (i.e. not at lunch?!) No lunch or dinner at hotel restaurant Breakfast greasy and unhealthy The lack of both the minibar and restaurant are "temporary". Well, they were also "temporarily" lacking the last time I stayed, which was some way back. Overall, though the prices are cheap, there are similarly-priced and better options in the area. I will not be coming back if I can help it.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: NvGiotto
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the millennium un plaza hotel for 3 nights prior to a trans atlantic cruise to the med. when we checked in the desk clerk asked us if we wanted a view of the new york sky line or the east river and the un. we picked the new york sky line. we were on the 22nd floor and the view of the chrysler and empire state building was fabulous. the hotel is situated in an area with many outstanding ethnic restaurants...possibly due to the proximity of the un. a truely outstanding hotel that i recommend highly. dennis

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, nice view”
Reviews.Author: JBUDAI
Reviews.Content: I was annoyed when I called about a cot and wasn't advised until check in that there was a fee per night for the use of a cot. They never charged us for it though. Staff were nice and helpful other than that though. The views were amazing, the hotel is not very updated, but decent enough. Good location. Interesting to be staying in the midst of all of the UN people.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnaPalindrome
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and very clean! The bathroom is big for one person. I loved staying at this hotel. The location is great if you have to be near the UN. However, it's a short walk to Grand Central where you have the trains and subways. Excellent staff! The only downside was the fitness center. Very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jervis76
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here on our honeymoon and were given a room in the East Tower on the 33rd floor, we looked out at the East River and Queens, it probably would have been a more picturesque view if we'd been on the other side looking at Manhattan but it was still a great view. The room itself was large and clean with a huge bed and tv and a decent standard of decor unlike some of the others that have been commented on. The only bit that did look a bit dated was the bathroom, everything worked in there but it just looked a bit tired and in need of updating. The walls did prove to be a bit thin, there was a baby in the room next to ours the first 3 nights, fortunately it didn't cry much but when it did the walls didn't do a lot to block out the noise. The maids who came in to do the housekeeping were very friendly and courteous when we saw them, both in the room and when passing them in the corridor and the concierge was friendly and efficient. The location was great, just a five minute walk to Grand Central and the subway and about 20 minutes walk to Times Square. Overall we enjoyed our stay and although there may be better hotels in New York we left with a positive impression of it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations. Amazing views. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: LolaBaggins
Reviews.Content: Reading Tripadvisor really helped. Upon check-in we asked if we can get a room in the west tower. Since it was only 11am in the morning, the room was not available but we were assured that they will save a nice room for us and to come back after lunch to get our room keys. Well, they certainly did not disappoint. We got a room on the 38th floor on the north west corner with the most amazing view of Manhattan. The room was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. We had one of our best sleeps at the Millenium UN in a very long time. The check-in staffs and concierge were the friendliest and most approachable. The breakfast buffet was quite decent with an assortment of fruits and pastry. Athough the price of a double espresso is close to $8 after tax and tips. For the same thing, you can go to Starbucks for under $2.50. All in all, a great stay at the Millenium UN and we will definiately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: copan28
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs major changes from room renovations to customer service. Even though the complex looks modern, the lobby and the restaurant looks more like a disco from the 70â€™s with its mirror walls. I think they also cut staff because there was only one person working at the check in causing long waits to check in and check out. I arrived at 1pm and they annoyed me immediately when they told me my room was not ready and that the check in time is at 3pm. I know for a fact that no hotel in NYC is at full capacity in this economy so it is not that there wasnâ€™t a room, it was probably that it was not cleaned in time for the next guest as they have few cleaning people working. At 2:50pm I tried to check in again and they keep saying check in is at 3 pm. So I was finally able to check in at 3pm. I believe the room was ready and they just wanted to make me wait 10 more minutes to comply with their process. In NYC, there is no time to waste and their job to accommodate guests, as best as they can, do not seem to be their top priority. The room that I stayed in was supposed to be an upgraded superior room but it looks more like a standard room (I looked at pics of their rooms on their website and other travel sites). My room was on a high floor so the views are magnificent. The dÃ©cor looks modern but the fixtures are coming apart and the walls have a lot of scruff marks. The bathroom was generous size but the bathtub looks grimy even though it is clean, there is mildew around the tiles surrounding the bathtub, the shower curtain was slightly moldy and the toilet had a very slow flush. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows seem to be overused by 5 years -when you lay down on them your head sinks to the bottom. It seems the only new items replaced are the large flat screen TV and toilet paper. Everything else is old, overused and poorly maintained. I also had the $19 buffet breakfast at the hotel restaurant. The food was just average and not that much of a selection. I believe the high cost was not for the food but for the service and presentation. Tablecloth covered the tables, cloth napkins and stem glasses for water and juice were used. The waiters were dressed for a fine restaurant dinner service which was not necessary for a morning buffet style breakfast service that only requires bus boys to clean the tables. The restaurant only operates for breakfast. This hotel is really for every type of travelers. Families with small children, old and young couples, business people, Africans associated with the UN, western Europeans, euro trash and flight attendants filled the hotel. There is a fee for wifi but you could get a free public connection in the lobby. If you want the newspaper you have to go to the lobby to get it. They will not slip the invoice under the door on your last day so you have to wait in line in the check in area. If you find a good deal then it is ok to stay in this hotel. I think the Millennium at Times Square is better as there is more competition to keep standards up.

Reviews.Title: “love love love”
Reviews.Author: jdubs2
Reviews.Content: so my friend and i had made this trip to nyc.... were young and from a small town so we didnt know what to expect... we got to nyc everthing ran smoothly till we got to the hotel the cab driver yelled at us for not tiping him enough even though he didnt help us with our luggage or anything and was rude completely i thought $7 is enough of a tip but oh well... we went inside and there was only one lady working and she didnt really help us at all and was giving us a hard time... we ended up waiting in the lobby for 2 and half hours before we even got to check in because she had to send faxes and what not all around cause she thought we were too young and lying... (the bellhops saw how frustrated we were and helped us, talked to us, and was exceptionally nice to us) FINALLY we were able to check in and she said we had to wait to get our room cause it was not ready...one of the bellhops said something to her then all of a sudden she gave us our room keys... we requested a room on the west tower since reading these reviews was better then the other so going up to our room we werent expecting much since we were on the east side... we get up to our room on the 34th floor she had upgraded us to a superior suite ... we had 2 entrances to our room , 2 bathrooms, 2 showers, a living room, 2 40" flatscreens, a mini fridge., and a great view it was perfect. clean and very modern .. since that time everyone was AMAZING... they totally made up for the wait... we revceived complimentary buffett breakfasts (which i may add DELICIOUS) and great service as well...we have a friend in nyc and he came to visit and also said we had a great hotel compared to alot of them in nyc where the rooms are small and no water pressure but we could shower at the same time and it be perfect ... the only thing is it is out of the way of main attractions and if you dont know how to use the subway(which we were taught how to :) ) or dont mind taking cabs around its fine...at first we thought this trip was going to be a disaster but tturned out to be sooo great... we even made friends with the lifeguard who got us great deals on lincoln cabs for cheap and even wanted to take us and show us around ... i would deffinitly go back again!!!!!! all staff was sooo great and so helpful and accomadating ( since no one else in the city helped us when we needed it ) we think maybe the girl at check in was just having a bad day :) one more thing... one night there was a huge thunder and lightening storm but we would have never known that if we werent looking outside.... you could hear nothing (soundproof)

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel needs to be redone!”
Reviews.Author: discountravel
Reviews.Content: The rugs as we got out of the elevator gross welted all wrinkled looked like a major flood happend when we got to our room the view was great but the walls gross food on them hand prints on the windows toothpaste on the wall in the bath room hair on the beds We changed rooms the other was a little better but just that!If you pay money to stay with your family you shouldn't be grossed out to sleep or brush your teeth

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: fluffynarnia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in NY for business at the UN, which made this location a perfect one! We stayed for 6 nights. I was wary before arriving at the hotel, because of the negative reviews that I had read on this site. I was pleasantly surprised in every way...by the staff, as they were all so pleasant and accommodating! They treated us like we were at a 4-5 star hotel. The pre-purchase price was the best deal in town, and had they had availability for a longer stay, we would have stayed there longer. The bed was rather soft, but it had a plush feel. Once I got used to it, I didn't want to get out of bed! The pillows were down, and we found them to be very comfortable. The down comforter made us feel right at home, since that's what we use on our bed. The Breakfast buffet was quite delicious. Yes, it was $18.95, which some reviewers have commented on as being pricey, but when you compare it to the prices in NY, it is quite reasonable. Everything is high in NY! The rooms do need some refurbishing, but they were all very clean, and huge! We had a room on the 40th floor, city view, and the view was magnificent! There was a bank of closets with sliding doors (with a safe), and a minibar area (which was no longer functional) with a cabinet on top (great for storing snacks, meds, etc. A sitting area near the windows that actually opens. We loved our room! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay out of the hub of the busyness of midtown. Traveling to other parts to sightsee is a bit time-consuming, but it's a nice and quiet area. If you don't mind walking a bit to the nearest subway, then this is a great location. However, if you don't have the energy or the time to walk to catch public transportation, then it's not the place for you. Cabs are easy to catch right in front of the hotel, as they are constantly dropping off guests to the hotel. I am very picky when it comes to hotels. But, I found the room to be quite nice...no problems with odors of any type, and one huge plus...it was not a window unit a/c. However, we found the temperature a bit difficult to control.
